column2: Parikh Construction Company  is looking for Land Surveyor  to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey    Survey Planning: Plan and organize surveying projects by reviewing project requirements, legal documents, and land records      Determine the most appropriate surveying methods, techniques, and equipment to achieve accurate and reliable results      Field Data Collection: Conduct field surveys using advanced surveying instruments and technologies, such as total stations, GPS receivers, and aerial drones      Measure distances, angles, elevations, and contours to determine the precise location and shape of land features and boundaries      Boundary Determination: Identify and establish property boundaries, easements, right-of-ways, and land titles using legal descriptions, deeds, plats, and survey monuments      Verify property lines and resolve boundary disputes through boundary surveys and retracement surveys      Topographic Mapping: Create detailed topographic maps and elevation models to depict the natural and man-made features of the land surface, including hills, valleys, water bodies, roads, and buildings      Collect and analyze elevation data to support engineering and design projects      Construction Layout: Provide construction layout services to guide the placement of buildings, roads, utilities, and infrastructure according to engineering plans and specifications      Set benchmarks, stakes, and reference points to ensure accurate and precise construction alignment and grading      Geodetic Control: Establish geodetic control points and coordinate systems to reference survey data to a common spatial framework      Perform geodetic surveys to accurately position and orient survey control networks over large areas      Data Processing and Analysis: Process, analyze, and interpret survey data using specialized software applications, such as CAD (Computer-Aided Design), GIS (Geographic Information Systems), and surveying software      Generate digital maps, drawings, and reports to document survey findings and conclusions      Quality Assurance: Conduct quality control checks and audits to verify the accuracy, reliability, and completeness of survey data and deliverables      Review surveying procedures, field notes, and calculations to ensure compliance with professional standards and regulatory requirements

column2: As a Highway Engineer, your role is to design, plan, and oversee the construction, maintenance, and improvement of highways, roads, and transportation infrastructure      You work on projects that involve the design and construction of new highways, as well as the rehabilitation and expansion of existing roadways      Here are some key responsibilities and tasks typically associated with the role of a Highway Engineer:Highway Design: Designing highways and roadways, including alignment, cross-sections, and geometric layouts      You consider factors such as traffic volume, speed limits, safety standards, and environmental impact to develop optimal designs      Traffic Analysis and Planning: Analyzing traffic patterns, conducting traffic studies, and forecasting future traffic demands to inform highway design and planning decisions      You consider factors such as traffic flow, capacity analysis, and intersection design to optimize traffic efficiency and safety        Pavement Design and Rehabilitation:        Designing and specifying pavement materials and thicknesses to ensure durability and safety      You assess pavement conditions, conduct structural analysis, and determine appropriate rehabilitation or reconstruction strategies      Drainage Design: Designing drainage systems, including culverts, stormwater management, and erosion control measures, to ensure proper water flow and prevent flooding or erosion along highways      Construction Supervision: Overseeing highway construction projects to ensure compliance with design specifications, quality standards, and safety regulations      You coordinate with contractors, monitor construction progress, and resolve any issues or challenges that arise during construction      Traffic Safety and Highway Operations: Implementing traffic control measures, signage, and markings to enhance safety and traffic flow on highways      You consider factors such as intersection design, signage placement, and traffic signal coordination to optimize highway operations      Environmental Considerations: Assessing and addressing environmental impacts associated with highway construction and operations      You evaluate potential impacts on air quality, noise pollution, and natural habitats, and develop mitigation strategies to minimize environmental harm      Project Management: Managing highway projects from inception to completion      This involves developing project plans, estimating costs, preparing bid documents, and overseeing project schedules and budgets      You collaborate with stakeholders, such as government agencies and local communities, to ensure project objectives are met
column11: Quality standards, Construction, Compliance, Project management, Infrastructure, highway design, Forecasting, Capacity analysis, Supervision, Structural analysis

column2: Designing infrastructure projects: The Civil Engineer must develop plans and designs for infrastructure projects, taking into account factors such as cost, safety, environmental impact, and construction feasibility.     Analyzing data: The Civil Engineer must analyze data, such as survey reports, environmental impact studies, and geotechnical reports, to inform design decisions and ensure that projects meet relevant standards and regulations.     Managing projects: The Civil Engineer must manage infrastructure projects from start to finish, including overseeing construction, coordinating with contractors and other stakeholders, and ensuring that projects are completed on time and within budget.     Conducting site inspections: The Civil Engineer must conduct site inspections to ensure that construction work is being performed according to plans and specifications, and to identify and address any issues that arise.     Ensuring safety and compliance: The Civil Engineer must ensure that infrastructure projects are designed and constructed to meet relevant safety standards and regulations, and that appropriate permits and approvals are obtained.     Maintaining infrastructure: The Civil Engineer must oversee maintenance and repairs of existing infrastructure, ensuring that it remains safe and functional for its intended use.To be successful as a Civil Engineer, candidates should have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, as well as excellent communication and project management skills. They should also have a solid understanding of engineering principles and practices, and be familiar with relevant regulations and standards.
column11: Civil, Construction, Data analysis, Compliance, Analytical, Project management, geotechnical, Management

column2: Role & responsibilities   A civil site engineer is responsible for overseeing construction projects from inception to completion, ensuring they meet design specifications, quality standards, and safety regulations. Here's a general job description for a civil site engineer role with a minimum experience requirement of 5 years: Job Title:  Civil Site Engineer Experience Required:  Minimum 5 years in civil engineering  Job Description: Project Management : Lead and manage civil engineering projects from start to finish, including planning, scheduling, and coordinating resources to ensure timely and within-budget completion. Site Supervision : Oversee construction activities on-site, ensuring adherence to design specifications, quality standards, and safety regulations. Conduct regular inspections to monitor progress and identify any issues or deviations from plans. Quality Assurance : Implement quality control measures to ensure that construction work meets industry standards and client requirements. Conduct quality inspections and tests as necessary to verify compliance. Contract Management : Review project contracts, specifications, and drawings to understand project requirements and scope. Monitor contractor performance and resolve any disputes or issues that may arise during construction. Coordination : Collaborate with architects, engineers, contractors, and other stakeholders to ensure effective communication and coordination throughout the project lifecycle. Address any design changes or modifications as necessary. Documentation : Maintain accurate records of project activities, including daily progress reports, material inspections, and correspondence with stakeholders. Prepare and review project documentation, including drawings, specifications, and reports. Safety Compliance : Enforce safety protocols and procedures on-site to prevent accidents and ensure a safe working environment for all personnel. Conduct safety inspections and audits to identify and mitigate potential hazards. Problem Solving : Identify and resolve technical issues or challenges encountered during construction, providing innovative solutions to ensure project continuity and success. Cost Management : Monitor project costs and expenditures, tracking budget allocations and expenditures to ensure financial accountability and cost-effectiveness. Client Relationship Management : Build and maintain positive relationships with clients, addressing their concerns and requirements throughout the project lifecycle. Provide regular updates and reports on project progress and performance. Qualifications: Bachelors degree in Civil Engineering or related field. Professional Engineer (PE) license preferred. Minimum 5 years of experience in civil engineering, with a focus on site supervision and project management. Proficiency in construction management software and tools. Strong knowledge of construction methods, materials, and techniques. Excellent communication, leadership, and problem-solving skills. Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. This job description outlines the key responsibilities and qualifications for a civil site engineer with at least 5 years of experience. Specific duties and requirements may vary depending on the nature and scope of the projects assigned. Preferred candidate profile   Perks and benefits

column2: Job Title: Civil Engineer Company Overview:   :  Greencentric Commercial projects is a leading turnkey interior firm specializing in creating innovative and functional spaces for both commercial and residential clients. With a focus on excellence and creativity, we pride ourselves on delivering exceptional design solutions that exceed our clients' expectations. As we continue to expand our operations, we are seeking a skilled Civil Engineer to join our team. Job Overview:  As a Civil Engineer at Greencentric Commercial Projects, you will be responsible for overseeing various aspects of the construction process, from design and planning to execution and completion. Your expertise in 2D drafting, AutoCAD, and project management will be essential in ensuring that projects are completed on time, within budget, and to the highest standards of quality. Key Responsibilities: 2D Drafting:  Proficient in AutoCAD 2D to create accurate technical drawings, blueprints, and plans for construction projects. Office Layout Preparation:  Develop office layouts and site plans that optimize space utilization, workflow efficiency, and safety standards. Site Visits:  Conduct regular site visits to monitor construction progress, ensure adherence to design specifications, and address any on-site issues or modifications. Bill of Quantities (BOQ) Preparation:  Prepare detailed BOQs outlining the quantities and specifications of materials, equipment, and labor required for each project. Bill Verification and On-Site Bill Preparation:  Review contractor bills and invoices, verify the accuracy of charges, and prepare on-site bills as needed. Certification and Verification of Vendor Bill:  Certify and verify vendor bills for materials and services provided, ensuring compliance with contractual agreements and project budgets. Estimation and Costing:  Conduct cost estimations for construction projects, including material costs, labor costs, and overhead expenses. IGBC Certification and Documentation (Preferable):  Knowledge of IGBC certification requirements and documentation for sustainable construction practices. MS Excel Proficiency:  Utilize MS Excel for data analysis, cost tracking, and project management purposes. Efficient Client Communication:  Maintain effective communication with clients, contractors, and project stakeholders to provide updates, address concerns, and ensure client satisfaction throughout the project lifecycle.         Qualifications: Diploma in Civil Engineering (Junior Engineer) or BE Civil (Senior Engineer) from a recognized institution. Proven experience (2-5 years) working as a Civil Engineer in the construction industry/Turnkey Interiors. Proficiency in AutoCAD 2D and other relevant design software. Strong knowledge of construction methods, materials, and building codes. Excellent project management and organizational skills. Ability to work effectively in a team environment and independently. Knowledge of IGBC certification (preferable but not mandatory). Proficiency in MS Excel and other Microsoft Office applications. Benefits: Competitive salary based on experience and qualifications. Health insurance and other benefits package. Opportunities for professional development and advancement within the company. Dynamic and collaborative work environment with a focus on innovation and growth. Join [Company Name] and contribute to the success of exciting construction projects that make a positive impact on communities. Apply now to take the next step in your career as a Civil Engineer! column2: Job Title: Civil Engineer (Finishing Work) Location: Mumbai International Airport, Mumbai, India Company Overview: We are a leading construction company specializing in infrastructure projects, committed to delivering high-quality results. Currently, we are seeking a diligent and experienced Civil Engineer to oversee finishing work at the Mumbai International Airport project. Job Description: As a Civil Engineer specializing in finishing work, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the successful completion of the project at Mumbai International Airport. Your responsibilities will encompass supervision, coordination, and management of various aspects related to finishing work, including but not limited to architectural finishes, interior works, and landscaping. You will work closely with the user team to meet their requirements and ensure adherence to project specifications and timelines. Key Responsibilities: 1.Supervise and oversee finishing work activities at Mumbai International Airport construction site. 2.Coordinate with the user team to understand their requirements and ensure that finishing work aligns with their expectations. 3.Manage manpower allocation and deployment effectively to optimize productivity and meet project deadlines. 4.Monitor material requirements and ensure timely procurement and deployment to the site. 5.Conduct regular inspections to ensure quality standards are met and work is progressing according to schedule. 6.Address any issues or challenges that arise during the finishing work phase and implement appropriate solutions. 7.Collaborate with architects, contractors, and other stakeholders to resolve technical queries and ensure smooth execution of finishing work. 8.Maintain accurate records of work progress, material usage, and manpower deployment. Requirements: 1.Bachelors degree in Civil Engineering or a related field. 2.Proven experience in overseeing finishing work on large-scale construction projects, preferably in airport infrastructure. 3.Strong knowledge of construction methodologies, materials, and techniques related to finishing work. 4.Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to effectively coordinate with the user team, contractors, and other stakeholders. 5.Ability to manage and lead a team of workers and subcontractors.  6. Proficiency in project management tools and software. 7.Familiarity with relevant building codes, regulations, and safety standards. 8.Problem-solving skills and the ability to work well under pressure. Preferred Qualifications: 1.Masters degree in Civil Engineering or a related field. 2.Professional certification or licensure as a Civil Engineer. 3.Previous experience working on airport construction projects. 4.Knowledge of sustainability practices in construction. Benefits: Competitive salary commensurate with experience and qualifications. Opportunities for professional development and advancement within the company. A dynamic and collaborative work environment. If you possess the required qualifications and are passionate about contributing to the successful completion of the Mumbai International Airport project, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.

Duties and Responsibilities Project Management: Lead and manage civil engineering projects from conception to completion, ensuring they are delivered on time, within budget, and in compliance with regulatory standards. Develop project plans, schedules, and budgets, and regularly report progress to senior management. Infrastructure Design and Maintenance: Collaborate with architects and engineering teams to design, plan, and implement civil infrastructure projects for the distillery. Ensure the maintenance and repair of existing civil structures, including buildings, roads, drainage systems, and utilities. Compliance and Safety: Ensure all civil engineering activities adhere to local, state, and federal regulations, including building codes and safety standards. Implement and enforce safety protocols to create a secure work environment for all employees and contractors. Vendor and Contractor Management: Select, hire, and manage contractors, architects, and engineering firms for civil projects. Negotiate contracts, review proposals, and ensure that contractors deliver work according to agreed-upon specifications. Budget Oversight: Develop and manage budgets for civil engineering projects, ensuring cost-effectiveness and efficiency. Monitor expenses, identify cost-saving opportunities, and report budget variances to management. Risk Management: Identify potential risks related to civil engineering projects and develop mitigation strategies. Proactively address challenges to prevent project delays or cost overruns. Collaboration and Communication: Foster effective communication and collaboration with cross-functional teams, including production, maintenance, safety, and environmental teams. Report progress and updates to senior management and stakeholders regularly. Documentation and Reporting: Maintain accurate and up-to-date project documentation, including drawings, specifications, and reports. Provide regular reports on project status, milestones achieved, and potential challenges. Qualifications and Requirements Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering or a related field. Proven experience in civil engineering and project management, preferably in the industrial or distillery sector. Strong knowledge of construction methodologies, building codes, and safety regulations. Excellent organizational, leadership, and communication skills Job Location : BCL (Distillery Unit) Sangat Kalan, Bathinda (Punjab)

column2: Job Title: Civil Supervisor Location:  GLA University Mathura Experience:  7-14 years Position Type:  Full-Time Job Summary:  The University Civil Engineer is a key member of the campus development team responsible for planning, designing, and managing various civil engineering projects on the university campus. This role requires a highly skilled and experienced civil engineer who can oversee the construction and maintenance of infrastructure, ensuring safety, compliance, and efficiency while enhancing the campus environment. The University is an equal opportunity employer and encourages candidates of all backgrounds to apply.   This Civil Engineer position offers an exciting opportunity to contribute to the development and improvement of the university's campus infrastructure. If you are a dedicated and experienced civil engineer with a passion for enhancing educational environments, we invite you to apply and become part of our dynamic campus development team.  Key Responsibilities: Project Planning and Management: Plan, coordinate, and manage civil engineering projects from conception to completion, ensuring they align with the university's objectives and regulations. Develop project scopes, budgets, and timelines while identifying potential risks and mitigation strategies. 2.  Design and Documentation: Prepare detailed engineering plans, specifications, and drawings for infrastructure projects, including roads, utilities, drainage systems, and buildings' foundation. Ensure designs comply with local building codes, safety standards, and sustainability principles. 3.  Construction Oversight: Oversee construction activities, providing guidance to contractors, monitoring progress, and addressing any issues that may arise. Ensure projects are completed on time, within budget, and to the required quality standards. 4.  Quality Assurance and Compliance: Conduct inspections and quality checks to guarantee compliance with engineering designs and safety standards. Stay up-to-date with relevant regulations, permits, and licensing requirements, and ensure the university remains compliant. 5.  Budget Management: Develop and manage project budgets, monitoring expenses, and cost-control measures. Seek cost-effective solutions while maintaining high-quality project outcomes. 6.  Environmental Sustainability: Implement sustainable and eco-friendly practices in civil engineering projects, such as rainwater harvesting, green infrastructure, and energy-efficient design. 7.  Collaboration and Stakeholder Engagement: Collaborate with university departments, architects, contractors, and regulatory agencies to facilitate the successful execution of projects. Communicate project updates and progress to university leadership and other stakeholders. 8.  Documentation and Reporting: Maintain accurate project records, including all plans, contracts, change orders, and project reports. Generate regular progress reports and provide updates to the Director of Campus Development. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering; Master's degree preferred. Professional Engineer (PE) license is required. 5-12 years of experience in civil engineering, with a focus on project management. Proficiency in civil engineering design software and AutoCAD. Strong knowledge of local building codes, regulations, and safety standards. Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills. Effective communication and interpersonal skills. Proven ability to lead and manage project teams.

column2: Contact Person - Aditya Shrivastava (8269586905) Role & responsibilities   Project Management : Supervising and managing the overall execution of construction projects from start to finish. This involves planning, organizing, and coordinating resources, schedules, and activities to ensure timely completion within budget constraints. Site Supervision : Overseeing day-to-day operations at construction sites, including monitoring progress, ensuring compliance with safety regulations, and resolving any issues or conflicts that may arise. Quality Control : Ensuring that construction activities meet quality standards and specifications set by the client, regulatory bodies, and industry best practices. This includes conducting inspections, implementing quality assurance measures, and addressing any deficiencies or deviations. Resource Management : Managing resources such as materials, equipment, and manpower efficiently to optimize productivity and minimize waste. This may involve procurement, inventory management, and resource allocation based on project requirements. Coordination : Liaising with various stakeholders involved in the project, including clients, architects, engineers, subcontractors, suppliers, and regulatory authorities. Facilitating effective communication and collaboration to ensure alignment and smooth workflow. Technical Expertise : Providing technical guidance and expertise on civil engineering principles, construction methodologies, and industry standards. Resolving technical challenges, interpreting drawings and specifications, and offering solutions to ensure construction activities proceed as planned. Budgeting and Cost Control : Participating in the budgeting process, estimating costs for materials, labor, and equipment, and monitoring expenses throughout the project lifecycle. Implementing cost-saving measures and identifying areas for optimization to ensure projects remain within budgetary constraints. Risk Management : Identifying potential risks and hazards associated with construction activities and implementing risk mitigation strategies to minimize their impact on project outcomes. This includes ensuring compliance with health, safety, and environmental regulations. Documentation and Reporting : Maintaining accurate records of project progress, expenditures, and other relevant information. Generating reports, progress updates, and documentation for internal purposes as well as client communication and regulatory compliance. Team Leadership : Leading and supervising a team of engineers, technicians, and laborers involved in construction activities. Providing guidance, mentorship, and training to foster a cohesive and high-performing team environment  Preferred candidate profile     Educational Qualification : Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering (B.E. Civil) with a minimum aggregate score of 75%. This ensures a strong foundation in engineering principles and technical knowledge relevant to the role. Communication Skills : Excellent verbal and written communication skills are essential for effective interaction with team members, clients, subcontractors, and other stakeholders. Clear and concise communication helps in conveying instructions, addressing concerns, and resolving conflicts efficiently. Team Leadership : Demonstrated ability to lead and motivate a diverse team of engineers, technicians, and laborers. Effective leadership involves providing direction, delegating tasks, resolving conflicts, and fostering a positive work environment to maximize productivity and achieve project objectives

column2: As a Planning Engineer, you will be responsible for developing and managing project schedules, coordinating resources, and ensuring the timely and efficient execution of various projects play a crucial role in optimizing project timelines and resource allocation to achieve project objectives within budget and on schedule        Key Responsibilities:        Develop detailed project schedules and plans, considering project scope, objectives, deliverables, and resource availability      Collaborate with project managers and engineering teams to identify project requirements and milestones      Use project scheduling software (eg, Primavera P6, Microsoft Project) to create and maintain project schedules, including critical path analysis      Monitor project progress and compare it with the planned schedule, identifying deviations and potential delays      Analyze resource allocation and workload distribution to ensure efficient utilization of resources      Conduct regular progress meetings with project teams and stakeholders to provide updates on project status and discuss any potential issues      Assess project risks and develop mitigation plans to address potential delays or challenges      Prepare and present periodic reports, dashboards, and analysis of project schedules and performance to senior management      Coordinate with various departments to ensure the timely availability of materials, equipment, and resources required for project activities      Review and evaluate project change requests and assess their impact on project schedules        Qualifications and Requirements:        Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Construction Management, or a related field      Proven experience as a Planning Engineer or in a similar role, preferably in the construction, engineering, or project management industry      Proficiency in project scheduling software (eg, Primavera P6, Microsoft Project) and other project management tools      Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to assess project timelines and identify potential risks      Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities to collaborate with project teams and stakeholders      Detail-oriented and capable of managing multiple projects simultaneously      Knowledge of project management methodologies and best practices      Understanding of construction processes and engineering principles is beneficial      Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a dynamic and fast-paced environment

column2: Role & responsibilities  :   Project Management : Plan, organize, and oversee construction projects from inception to completion, including scheduling, budgeting, and resource allocation. Site Supervision : Supervise construction activities on-site, ensuring adherence to project plans, specifications, and safety regulations. Contractor Management : Coordinate with subcontractors, vendors, and suppliers to ensure timely delivery of materials and services required for construction. Quality Control : Implement and maintain quality control procedures to ensure that construction work meets specified standards and specifications. Safety Compliance : Enforce and promote strict adherence to safety protocols and regulations to create a safe working environment for all personnel on-site. Progress Reporting : Regularly report on project progress, including milestones achieved, challenges encountered, and proposed solutions. Problem-Solving : Identify and resolve construction-related issues and challenges in a timely and effective manner to minimize project delays and disruptions. column2: 1.	Designing infrastructure projects: The Civil Engineer must develop plans and designs for infrastructure projects, taking into account factors such as cost, safety, environmental impact, and construction feasibility.   2.	Analyzing data: The Civil Engineer must analyze data, such as survey reports, environmental impact studies, and geotechnical reports, to inform design decisions and ensure that projects meet relevant standards and regulations.   3.	Managing projects: The Civil Engineer must manage infrastructure projects from start to finish, including overseeing construction, coordinating with contractors and other stakeholders, and ensuring that projects are completed on time and within budget.   4.	Conducting site inspections: The Civil Engineer must conduct site inspections to ensure that construction work is being performed according to plans and specifications, and to identify and address any issues that arise.   5.	Ensuring safety and compliance: The Civil Engineer must ensure that infrastructure projects are designed and constructed to meet relevant safety standards and regulations, and that appropriate permits and approvals are obtained.   6.	Maintaining infrastructure: The Civil Engineer must oversee maintenance and repairs of existing infrastructure, ensuring that it remains safe and functional for its intended use.   To be successful as a Civil Engineer, candidates should have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, as well as excellent communication and project management skills. They should also have a solid understanding of engineering principles and practices, and be familiar with relevant regulations and standards.

column2: Design and Planning: Civil engineers are involved in the planning and design of various infrastructure projects such as roads, bridges, buildings, water supply and distribution systems, sewage systems, and more. They use engineering principles, mathematics, and computer-aided design (CAD) software to create detailed plans and specifications.       Construction and Project Management: Civil engineers oversee the construction phase of projects, ensuring that designs are executed accurately and safely. They manage construction teams, monitor progress, coordinate resources, and address any challenges that arise during construction.       Structural Engineering: Civil engineers specialize in structural engineering, which involves designing and analyzing the structural components of buildings, bridges, and other structures to ensure they can withstand loads and environmental conditions.       Geotechnical Engineering: Geotechnical engineers within civil engineering focus on the behavior of soil and rock materials to design foundations, slopes, and other structures that interact with the ground.       Transportation Engineering: Civil engineers in transportation design and plan transportation systems, including roads, highways, airports, and railways, with a focus on efficient traffic flow and safety.   Water Resources Engineering: Water resources engineers design and manage systems related to water supply, drainage, flood control, and wastewater treatment.       Environmental Engineering: Environmental engineers within civil engineering address the environmental impact of infrastructure projects, including waste management, pollution control, and sustainability considerations.

column2: Job Description:  We are looking for a skilled Civil Engineer with at least 3 years of experience in construction to join our team remotely. The Civil Engineer will play a crucial role in overseeing and managing construction projects, ensuring they are completed safely, on time, and within budget while meeting quality standards. Responsibilities: Design and plan civil engineering aspects of construction projects, including site layout, grading, drainage, and utility systems. Prepare and review engineering drawings, specifications, and construction documents to ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and project specifications. Conduct site visits and surveys to assess project feasibility, identify potential challenges, and make recommendations for improvements or modifications. Collaborate with architects, project managers, and other stakeholders to develop project plans, schedules, and budgets, and ensure alignment with client objectives. Manage and oversee construction activities, including subcontractor coordination,      materials procurement, quality control, and safety compliance. Monitor  project progress, track expenses, and report on key performance indicators (KPIs) to stakeholders, providing regular updates and recommendations for optimization. Conduct engineering analyses, calculations, and simulations to evaluate structural      integrity, load capacities, and environmental impact, and propose solutions as needed. Review  and approve change orders, RFIs, and submittals, and address any design or      construction issues to maintain project timelines and quality standards. Collaborate  with regulatory agencies, obtain necessary permits and approvals, and ensure project compliance with building codes, zoning regulations, and environmental standards. Provide technical guidance and support to project teams, mentor junior engineers, and contribute to continuous improvement initiatives to enhance engineering processes and outcomes. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering or related field; Professional Engineer (PE) license preferred. Minimum of 3 years of experience as a Civil Engineer or similar role in the construction industry. Proficiency  in AutoCAD, Estimation softwares and other engineering software. Strong knowledge of engineering principles, construction methods, materials, and      regulations. Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills. Effective  communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate with multidisciplinary teams and stakeholders. Detail-oriented, organized, and able to prioritize tasks effectively in a fast-paced      environment. Familiarity with project management principles and software is a plus. Willingness to work remotely.

column2: Role & responsibilities: Outlin Job Description We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced individual with over 10 years of experience in civil engineering, particularly in project management, to lead our Civil Engineering department as the Head of Civil Engineering. As the Head of Civil Engineering, you will oversee all aspects of civil engineering projects, manage a team of engineers and technicians, and ensure the successful completion of projects within budget and on schedule. Responsibilities 1. Project Management- Lead and manage civil engineering projects from inception to completion, ensuring adherence to project specifications, timelines, and budget constraints. 2. Team Leadership- Provide leadership, guidance, and mentorship to a team of civil engineers, designers, and technicians, fostering a collaborative and innovative work environment. 3. Strategic Planning - Develop and implement strategic plans to enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of the Civil Engineering department, aligning with the company's overall goals and objectives. 4. Resource Allocation - Allocate resources effectively to optimize project outcomes, including personnel, equipment, and materials. 5. Quality Assurance - Ensure the highest standards of quality and compliance with regulatory requirements in all civil engineering projects. 6. Client Relationship Management - Cultivate and maintain strong relationships with clients, understanding their needs and expectations, and ensuring their satisfaction with project deliverables. 7. Risk Management - Identify potential risks and challenges in civil engineering projects and implement proactive measures to mitigate them. 8. Budget Management - Develop and manage project budgets, monitor expenditures, and implement cost-saving measures where possible. 9. Innovation and Research - Stay abreast of industry trends, best practices, and technological advancements in civil engineering, and integrate innovative solutions into project designs and processes. 10. Collaboration- Collaborate with other departments within the organization to ensure seamless integration and coordination of interdisciplinary projects. 11. Travelling - visit the different sites to oversee there is no project cost overrun. The candidate shall be ok with frequent travels. 12. Plans, assigns, supervises, and reviews Structural-Design/ Architectural/ MEP-Design/ Quantity Survey for planning, designing, cost estimating. 13. Develop working method based on QMS and other given guidelines. 14. Carry out technical and feasibility studies and draw up blueprints that satisfy technical specifications. 15. Expertise in AutoCAD, familiarity with codes and structures issued by Bureau of Indian Standards (BIS) relevant to civil engineering disciplines such as IS 456 for concrete, IS 800 for steel structures and IS 893 for seismic design. Qualifications: 1. Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering; Master's degree preferred. 2. Minimum of 10 years of experience in civil engineering, with a proven track record of managing complex projects. 3. Strong project management skills, including experience in leading and coordinating teams. 4. Excellent leadership and team management skills, with the ability to inspire and motivate a diverse team of professionals. 5. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively interact with clients, stakeholders, and team members at all levels. 6. Proficiency in project management software and other relevant tools. 7. In-depth knowledge of civil engineering principles, practices, and regulations. 8. Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities, with a keen attention to detail. 9. Commitment to continuous learning and professional development. Benefits Competitive Salary and Benefits as per Industry standard Opportunity to spearhead one of India's best Real Estate companies e the day-to-day responsibilities for this role. Preferred candidate profile: Specify required role expertise, previous job experience, or relevant certifications. Perks and benefits: Mention available facilities and benefits the company is offering with this job.

column2: Role & responsibilities   We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Project Coordinator to join our team for a prestigious  high-rise luxury residential project in the Suburbs. The ideal candidate will possess technical expertise in  RCC structures, finishes, MEPF trades coordination, as well as a thorough understanding of site logistics,  planning, risk management, and strategy for fast-track construction techniques and innovative  construction methods. The Project Coordinator will play a crucial role in ensuring the successful execution  of the project from inception to completion.   1. Technical Coordination: - Coordinate with architects, engineers, consultants, and contractors to ensure proper coordination of  RCC structures, finishes, MEPF trades, and other technical aspects. - Review construction drawings, specifications, and documents to identify and resolve any discrepancies  or conflicts. - Monitor the progress of consultant deliverables in line with Project Master Schedule and ongoing  construction activities and ensure adherence to quality standards and project specifications.  2. Site Logistics and Planning: - Develop and implement site logistics plans to optimize the use of resources, equipment, and manpower. - Coordinate with site management teams to plan and schedule construction activities, material deliveries,  and equipment mobilization. - Anticipate and mitigate potential construction-related challenges and obstacles to ensure smooth  project execution.  3. Strategy for Fast-Track Construction Techniques: - Identify opportunities for implementing fast-track construction techniques to expedite project timelines  while maintaining quality and safety standards. - Collaborate with project stakeholders to develop innovative construction methods and strategies to  enhance efficiency and productivity.  4. Formwork Planning: - Evaluate and select appropriate types of formwork systems based on project requirements, structural  design, and construction methodology. - Develop formwork plans and schedules to ensure timely installation, removal, and reusability of  formwork systems.  5. Risk Management: - Identify potential risks and uncertainties associated with the project and develop risk mitigation  strategies. - Conduct regular risk assessments and implement measures to minimize the impact of identified risks on  project objectives. - Collaborate with project stakeholders to ensure compliance with safety regulations and protocols to  mitigate construction-related risks.    Preferred candidate profile   Minimum of 8 to 13 Years of experience in project coordination or management,  preferably in high-rise residential construction projects. Strong technical knowledge of RCC structures,  finishes, MEPF trades, and construction methods. Proficiency in project management software and tools. Excellent communication, leadership, and interpersonal skills.

column2: 1. Completion of the Project on Time  Execute monthly plan based on the master schedule Set weekly target based on monthly target Track weekly targets on a daily basis    2. Ensuring Material Delivery on Time Ensure material delivery on time. So that construction work progress doesn't hamper due to the shortage of materials. For ensuring materials delivery on time not before the time, you need to do the following things  Estimate the required materials for the task you are going to start next. Make requisition for the materials. Mention the material delivery date on the purchase requisition. Send the requisition to the purchasing department on time. In a company, it requires some time to be approved the purchase requisition. There are some formalities. So, make sure you maintain the lead time for the material delivery. Track the requisition. So that you don't miss the delivery date of the materials.   3. Ensuring Materials Quality   Ensure the quality of delivered materials. After receiving materials for the project, just check the quality of those materials.    4. Ensuring Quality of Work  To ensure construction work quality in a building construction project, do the followings  Train project Team about the quality of work. Discuss with the Team about work quality on a regular basis. Give a brief speech to workers before starting the day's work. Motivate them to maintain the quality of work. Regularly visit places where the work is going on. Ensure all non-conformance reports raised at any stage of construction are closed out after satisfactory verification checks. All relevant quality check records at each stage of construction work are created and maintained for future reference. Conduct training for staff on quality improvement, frequent errors, new / better techniques of execution, etc.    5. Ensuring the Safety of the Project More conscious about the safety of your building construction project. Aware workers about safety. Motivate workers to use personal safety tools. Give them training in using safety materials. Secure all the voids and openings in your building project. Ensure PPE (Personal protective equipment) is being appropriately used by all workers on site such as helmets, safety belts, and safety shoes. Ensure working platforms are sturdy enough, safety railings are fitted, all openings/ducts are closed appropriately, and electrical connections for equipment are done as per requirement.   6. Reporting and Billing and Review Performance   Prepare from time-to-time project reports and contractor's bills depending on the rules of the project management team or the company. Work status of the project. Budget for different stages of work. Cost for a selected time duration. Bill of contractors, etc. Review monthly work performance and quarterly work order performance of Contractors through evaluation forms on a quarterly basis Organize counseling sessions for poor-performing contractors. To prepare an abstract (Bill of measurement) of actual work executed on site and verify it is as per quality parameters mentioned in the work/contract order    7.   Provide all relevant data/updates about the project required for the planning and contract process   Give timely inputs to the Contract team about changes in the scope of the contract. Give input to planning dept. after comparing the actual resources mobilized/receivables with the planned ones on a weekly basis. Review daily/weekly progress reports (DPR & WPR) for an allotted set of buildings and intimate the Planning team in case of any discrepancy. Conduct weekly/monthly project progress review meetings.  8 .  Material wastage   Prepare optimum organizational structure i.e. functional and reporting matrix at the site level along with the deployment and release dates of the staff at the site. Monitor and review consumption reports against budgeted consumption. Any deviation from the budget should be investigated further.  Desired Candidate Profile   5 -10 Years/Real estate industry experience preferred/ Local Resident preferred/ Expertise in Strategic ERP project engineering module added advantage. Candidate should have commercial and High-rise Residential Building (RCC & Finishing) work experience.  Experienced In Bungalow projects preferred. Perks and Benefits   Salary and Benefits will be commensurate with qualifications & experience and will not be a limiting factor for deserving candidates. Bachelor Accommodation

column2: Role & responsibilities   A civil site engineer is responsible for overseeing construction projects from inception to completion, ensuring they meet design specifications, quality standards, and safety regulations. Here's a general job description for a civil site engineer role with a minimum experience requirement of 5 years: Job Title:  Civil Site Engineer Experience Required:  Minimum 5 years in civil engineering  Job Description: Project Management : Lead and manage civil engineering projects from start to finish, including planning, scheduling, and coordinating resources to ensure timely and within-budget completion. Site Supervision : Oversee construction activities on-site, ensuring adherence to design specifications, quality standards, and safety regulations. Conduct regular inspections to monitor progress and identify any issues or deviations from plans. Quality Assurance : Implement quality control measures to ensure that construction work meets industry standards and client requirements. Conduct quality inspections and tests as necessary to verify compliance. Contract Management : Review project contracts, specifications, and drawings to understand project requirements and scope. Monitor contractor performance and resolve any disputes or issues that may arise during construction. Coordination : Collaborate with architects, engineers, contractors, and other stakeholders to ensure effective communication and coordination throughout the project lifecycle. Address any design changes or modifications as necessary. Documentation : Maintain accurate records of project activities, including daily progress reports, material inspections, and correspondence with stakeholders. Prepare and review project documentation, including drawings, specifications, and reports. Safety Compliance : Enforce safety protocols and procedures on-site to prevent accidents and ensure a safe working environment for all personnel. Conduct safety inspections and audits to identify and mitigate potential hazards. Problem Solving : Identify and resolve technical issues or challenges encountered during construction, providing innovative solutions to ensure project continuity and success. Cost Management : Monitor project costs and expenditures, tracking budget allocations and expenditures to ensure financial accountability and cost-effectiveness. Client Relationship Management : Build and maintain positive relationships with clients, addressing their concerns and requirements throughout the project lifecycle. Provide regular updates and reports on project progress and performance. Qualifications: Bachelors degree in Civil Engineering or related field. Professional Engineer (PE) license preferred. Minimum 5 years of experience in civil engineering, with a focus on site supervision and project management. Proficiency in construction management software and tools. Strong knowledge of construction methods, materials, and techniques. Excellent communication, leadership, and problem-solving skills. Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. This job description outlines the key responsibilities and qualifications for a civil site engineer with at least 5 years of experience. Specific duties and requirements may vary depending on the nature and scope of the projects assigned. Preferred candidate profile   Perks and benefits

column2: Role & responsibilities     Supervising   and managing construction projects from start to finish, ensuring adherence   to project plans and specifications. Reporting   project updates, milestones and potential risks to the design team and   solving the issues within the team Analysing   and interpreting engineering drawings, survey reports and other technical   documentation to guide the construction process. Planning   and overseeing, allocating resources, materials and equipment to optimise   project efficiency. Monitoring   project costs, identifying cost-saving opportunities and adhering to budget constraints. Handling the team (Jr. Site Engineer and allocating the work to them)  Preferred candidate profile     Manage,   design, develop, create and maintain small-scale through to large-scale   construction projects in a safe, timely and sustainable manner. Conduct regular   site inspections to monitor progress, identify potential issues and ensure   compliance with engineering and design requirements. Collaborate   closely with project managers, architects and subcontractors to ensure timely   project completion. Maintain   accurate project documentation, including progress reports, site diaries,   change orders and quality control measures. You will   be responsible for planning, marking out and levelling construction sites   before any building work takes place. Reviewing   work schedules and delegating work tasks Organizing   construction materials and negotiating with the vendors Conducting   preliminary inspections at potential construction sites Gathering   data and writing site reports and other necessary work documentation Preparing   BOQ for each project before starting the project Determining   project feasibility and giving approval Maintain   compliance with safety and regulatory standards  Suggest   process and technical design changes to improve performance and efficiency, implement   improvements to designs and processes  Research   the environmental impact of projects  Incorporate   eco-friendly and sustainable features into design plans  Prepare   proposal documents and presentations  Compile   and present reports explaining project details to non-technical team  Maintain detailed documentation of all site engineering activities     Knowledge and Skills   Requirements: To be   successful in this field, one must be creative, a fast thinker and good at   problem solving. column2: Roles & Responsibilities:   Project Execution: Oversee the on-site execution of wastewater and sewerage network projects, ensuring compliance with approved design, CPHEEO manual, and industry standards. Coordinate with project managers, deputy project managers, HO engineers, and stakeholders to ensure project milestones are achieved within the defined timelines. Design Interpretation: Read, understand, and interpret design and engineering drawings related to sewerage networks and sewage treatment plants. Collaborate with the design team to clarify any design-related queries and ensure accurate implementation on-site. Technical Expertise: Apply in-depth knowledge of wastewater treatment techniques, sewerage network laying, and relevant construction methodologies. Implement quality control measures to maintain the desired project outcomes and standards. Leadership and Team Management: Lead and supervise a team of laborers and skilled workers on-site, ensuring proper allocation of tasks and efficient resource utilization. Foster a collaborative work environment that promotes teamwork, safety, and productivity. Subcontractor Coordination: Communicate effectively with subcontractors and storekeeping team for proper use of materials at site for timely execution of works. Monitor subcontractor activities, resolve issues, and ensure adherence to project specifications. Site Ownership and Progress Tracking: Take ownership of the project site, ensuring a well-organized and safe working environment. Regularly monitor project progress, identify bottlenecks, and take proactive measures to ensure smooth workflow. Documentation and Reporting: Prepare and submit formats provided by HO for execution of sewerage laying and road restoration works on a daily basis. Maintain accurate records of site activities, including work progress, material usage, and labor hours. Generate periodic progress reports and update project managers on the status of the project. Qualifications and Skills: Diploma in Civil Engineering (mandatory), Bachelor's in Civil Engineering (preferred). Proven experience in executing sewerage network projects and sewage treatment plants as per approved designs and CPHEEO manual. Proficiency in reading and interpreting engineering drawings and technical documents. Strong leadership skills with the ability to manage and motivate a team on-site. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate with stakeholders, subcontractors, and team members. Result-oriented mindset with a proactive approach to problem-solving. Demonstrated ability to work under pressure and meet project deadlines. Familiarity with safety regulations and practices in construction environments. If you are a dedicated Civil Engineer with a passion for wastewater and sewage projects and a desire to contribute to critical infrastructure development, we invite you to join our team at Technocraft Construction Private Limited. We offer a competitive salary, a cordial team and environment, professional growth opportunities, and the chance to work on impactful projects that benefit communities and the environment.   Contact Person ; Vinay Kumar (Manager HR Administration) Contact No. 9870507119 Required Immediately Joiner Candidate

column2: We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Site Engineer to join our construction team      As a Senior Site Engineer, you will be responsible for overseeing and managing on-site construction activities, ensuring adherence to project specifications, timelines, and quality standards      If you have a proven track record in site management, strong leadership skills, and a comprehensive understanding of construction processes, we invite you to apply for this challenging role        Responsibilities:        Project Oversight: Provide overall on-site leadership and direction for construction projects      Ensure projects are completed on time, within budget, and in compliance with regulatory requirements      Site Management: Supervise and coordinate day-to-day activities on the construction site      Monitor progress, resolve issues, and ensure the efficient use of resources      Quality Assurance: Implement and enforce quality control measures to ensure work meets project specifications and industry standards      Conduct regular inspections and address any deviations promptly      Subcontractor Coordination: Collaborate with subcontractors and other project stakeholders      Manage relationships, coordinate activities, and ensure timely delivery of services      Budget and Cost Control: Monitor project budgets and costs      Identify areas for cost savings and efficiency improvements      Provide regular updates on financial performance to project management      Safety Compliance: Implement and enforce safety protocols and standards on the construction site      Conduct regular safety meetings, inspections, and audits to ensure a secure working environment      Progress Reporting: Prepare and submit regular progress reports to project management      Provide updates on milestones, challenges, and resolutions      Technical Problem-Solving: Address technical issues and challenges that arise during the construction process      Collaborate with engineering and design teams to find effective solutions      Documentation: Maintain accurate and up-to-date project documentation, including site diaries, reports, and as-built drawings      Ensure all records are in compliance with project requirements      Team Leadership: Lead and motivate on-site construction teams      Foster a positive and collaborative work environment      Provide guidance, training, and mentorship to junior staff

column2: Job Description Designation- Site Engineer Experience- 3-5 years Immediate Joiner required Supervising and managing construction projects from start to finish, ensuring adherence to project plans and specifications. Should have experience in finishing activities ex - Electrical, Plumbing, Block work, Plastering, Flooring & Dado works(Tiling, Granite, marble), Painting.  Should have experience in Interior works. Reporting project updates, milestones and potential risks to the project manager and key stakeholders. Analysing and interpreting engineering drawings, survey reports and other technical documentation to guide the construction process. Planning and overseeing allocating resources, materials and equipment to optimise project efficiency. Monitoring project costs, identifying cost-saving opportunities and adhering to budget constraints. Providing technical guidance and expertise to resolve construction-related challenges. Your tasks Oversee and manage construction activities at the site, ensuring adherence to project specifications, codes and safety regulations. Conduct regular site inspections to monitor progress, identify potential issues and ensure compliance with engineering and design requirements. Collaborate closely with project managers, architects and subcontractors to ensure timely project completion. Analyse and interpret engineering plans, aerial photography, blueprints, topographical & geologic data and technical drawings to plan and execute construction activities. Coordinate the procurement and delivery of construction materials, ensuring their compliance with industry standards. Identifying potential risks and implementing preventive measures to minimise project delays, cost overruns and safety hazards. Maintain accurate project documentation, including progress reports, site diaries, change orders and quality control measures.   Required skills and qualifications 3-5 years of experience as a site engineer, civil engineer or an equivalent role. Demonstrated proficiency in managing and supervising construction projects. Experience with Microsoft Office Suite, GIS, AutoCAD and other software. Ability to manage multiple construction projects at various stages of their lifecycle. Strong knowledge of construction methods, materials and regulations. Competent in assessing, interpreting and presenting survey reports and other critical data for stakeholders and shareholders. Excellent project management and organisational skills. Strong problem-solving and decision-making abilities with effective communication. Ability to work effectively in a team and coordinate with multiple stakeholders. Attention to detail and a focus on delivering high-quality results.

column2: Contact Person - Aditya Shrivastava (8269586905) Role & responsibilities   Project Management : Supervising and managing the overall execution of construction projects from start to finish. This involves planning, organizing, and coordinating resources, schedules, and activities to ensure timely completion within budget constraints. Site Supervision : Overseeing day-to-day operations at construction sites, including monitoring progress, ensuring compliance with safety regulations, and resolving any issues or conflicts that may arise. Quality Control : Ensuring that construction activities meet quality standards and specifications set by the client, regulatory bodies, and industry best practices. This includes conducting inspections, implementing quality assurance measures, and addressing any deficiencies or deviations. Resource Management : Managing resources such as materials, equipment, and manpower efficiently to optimize productivity and minimize waste. This may involve procurement, inventory management, and resource allocation based on project requirements. Coordination : Liaising with various stakeholders involved in the project, including clients, architects, engineers, subcontractors, suppliers, and regulatory authorities. Facilitating effective communication and collaboration to ensure alignment and smooth workflow. Technical Expertise : Providing technical guidance and expertise on civil engineering principles, construction methodologies, and industry standards. Resolving technical challenges, interpreting drawings and specifications, and offering solutions to ensure construction activities proceed as planned. Budgeting and Cost Control : Participating in the budgeting process, estimating costs for materials, labor, and equipment, and monitoring expenses throughout the project lifecycle. Implementing cost-saving measures and identifying areas for optimization to ensure projects remain within budgetary constraints. Risk Management : Identifying potential risks and hazards associated with construction activities and implementing risk mitigation strategies to minimize their impact on project outcomes. This includes ensuring compliance with health, safety, and environmental regulations. Documentation and Reporting : Maintaining accurate records of project progress, expenditures, and other relevant information. Generating reports, progress updates, and documentation for internal purposes as well as client communication and regulatory compliance. Team Leadership : Leading and supervising a team of engineers, technicians, and laborers involved in construction activities. Providing guidance, mentorship, and training to foster a cohesive and high-performing team environment  Preferred candidate profile     Educational Qualification : Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering (B.E. Civil) with a minimum aggregate score of 75%. This ensures a strong foundation in engineering principles and technical knowledge relevant to the role. Communication Skills : Excellent verbal and written communication skills are essential for effective interaction with team members, clients, subcontractors, and other stakeholders. Clear and concise communication helps in conveying instructions, addressing concerns, and resolving conflicts efficiently. Team Leadership : Demonstrated ability to lead and motivate a diverse team of engineers, technicians, and laborers. Effective leadership involves providing direction, delegating tasks, resolving conflicts, and fostering a positive work environment to maximize productivity and achieve project objectives

column2: As a Senior Site Engineer, your role is to oversee and manage construction projects at the site level      You work closely with the project team, including architects, contractors, and subcontractors, to ensure successful project execution      Your responsibilities may vary depending on the specific project and organization, but here are some common tasks and responsibilities associated with the role of a Senior Site Engineer:Project Planning and Coordination: Collaborating with the project team to develop project plans, timelines, and budgets      You coordinate with various stakeholders, including architects, engineers, and contractors, to ensure that project goals and objectives are met      Construction Supervision: Overseeing construction activities at the site to ensure that work is executed according to approved plans, specifications, and quality standards      You monitor progress, review workmanship, and address any issues or challenges that arise during construction      Quality Control: Implementing quality control measures to ensure that construction work meets specified standards      You conduct inspections, perform tests, and verify compliance with regulations and project requirements      You also document and report any deviations or non-conformities      Resource Management: Managing resources at the site, including labor, materials, and equipment      You coordinate with suppliers and subcontractors to ensure timely delivery of materials and equipment      You also supervise and allocate work to site staff and monitor their performance      Safety and Risk Management: Promoting and enforcing a safe working environment at the construction site      You ensure compliance with safety regulations, conduct safety inspections, and address any safety concerns      You identify and mitigate risks related to site activities and implement appropriate risk management measures
column11: Quality standards, Compliance, construction site, Project planning, Manager Quality Control, Risk management, Resource management, Monitoring, Project execution

column2: We are seeking a skilled and motivated Civil Engineer to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing, planning, and overseeing construction projects, ensuring their successful completion within budget and on schedule. The Civil Engineer will collaborate with architects, contractors, and other professionals to ensure projects meet technical specifications and regulatory requirements. Responsibilities: Develop and design construction projects, including roads, bridges, buildings, and infrastructure. Prepare engineering drawings, plans, and specifications using CAD software. Perform site investigations and surveys to assess project feasibility and constraints. Analyze survey reports, maps, and other data to plan project layouts and establish construction methods. Calculate construction costs and prepare project budgets. Obtain necessary permits and approvals from regulatory authorities. Supervise construction activities to ensure compliance with design specifications and safety standards. Conduct quality control inspections to monitor work progress and identify deficiencies. Collaborate with architects, contractors, and subcontractors to resolve technical issues and ensure project success. Evaluate and recommend materials and equipment for construction projects. Provide technical expertise and support to project teams throughout all project phases. Keep abreast of industry trends, best practices, and advancements in civil engineering technology. Communicate effectively with clients, stakeholders, and team members to address concerns and deliver updates on project status. Requirements: Bachelors degree in Civil Engineering or related field. Professional Engineer (PE) license preferred. Proven experience in civil engineering design, construction, and project management. Proficiency in CAD software and other relevant engineering tools. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities. Ability to work independently and as part of a multidisciplinary team. Attention to detail and a commitment to quality. Knowledge of applicable codes, regulations, and standards. Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and prioritize tasks effectively. column2: Job Title: Onsite Civil Engineer Location: Odisha Compensation: Up to 5.5 LPA  Job Summary:  The onsite civil engineer is responsible for overseeing civil, structural, and landscape works on-site and certifying bills of executed work. They ensure that construction activities meet design specifications, regulatory requirements, and quality standards while managing project costs and schedules. Key Responsibilities: 1. Construction Oversight: Supervising civil, structural, and landscape construction activities on-site, including earthwork, concrete works, masonry, drainage systems, roads, and landscaping. Ensuring compliance with project plans, specifications, codes, standards, and regulatory guidelines. 2. Quality Assurance: Implementing quality assurance processes to verify the quality and performance of civil, structural, and landscape works. Conducting inspections, tests, and audits to ensure workmanship,materials, and installations meet quality standards. 3. Bill Certification: Reviewing and certifying bills of executed work for civil, structural, and landscape works based on completed milestones, quantities, and specifications. Collaborating with quantity surveyors, contractors, and project teams to accurately certify and document progress for billing purposes. 4. Quantity Estimation: Estimating quantities of materials, for civil, structural, and landscape works based on architectural, structural and landscape designs and specifications. Verifying quantities against actual measurements, as-built drawings, and site conditions. 5. Cost Monitoring: Identifying cost-saving opportunities, variations, and discrepancies, and recommending corrective actions. 6. Schedule Management: Managing construction schedules, milestones, and timelines for civil, structural, and landscape works. Coordinating with project managers, contractors, and stakeholders to ensure timely completion of work. 7. Documentation and Reporting: Maintaining accurate records of construction activities, bill certifications, quantity estimations, progress reports, and as-built drawings. Providing regular updates, reports, and documentation to project stakeholders, management, and regulatory authorities. 8. Safety Compliance: Enforcing safety protocols, guidelines, and regulatory requirements to ensure a safe working environment for construction teams and site personnel. column2: 1. Completion of the Project on Time  Execute monthly plan based on the master schedule Set weekly target based on monthly target Track weekly targets on a daily basis    2. Ensuring Material Delivery on Time Ensure material delivery on time. So that construction work progress doesn't hamper due to the shortage of materials. For ensuring materials delivery on time not before the time, you need to do the following things  Estimate the required materials for the task you are going to start next. Make requisition for the materials. Mention the material delivery date on the purchase requisition. Send the requisition to the purchasing department on time. In a company, it requires some time to be approved the purchase requisition. There are some formalities. So, make sure you maintain the lead time for the material delivery. Track the requisition. So that you don't miss the delivery date of the materials.   3. Ensuring Materials Quality   Ensure the quality of delivered materials. After receiving materials for the project, just check the quality of those materials.    4. Ensuring Quality of Work  To ensure construction work quality in a building construction project, do the followings  Train project Team about the quality of work. Discuss with the Team about work quality on a regular basis. Give a brief speech to workers before starting the day's work. Motivate them to maintain the quality of work. Regularly visit places where the work is going on. Ensure all non-conformance reports raised at any stage of construction are closed out after satisfactory verification checks. All relevant quality check records at each stage of construction work are created and maintained for future reference. Conduct training for staff on quality improvement, frequent errors, new / better techniques of execution, etc.    5. Ensuring the Safety of the Project More conscious about the safety of your building construction project. Aware workers about safety. Motivate workers to use personal safety tools. Give them training in using safety materials. Secure all the voids and openings in your building project. Ensure PPE (Personal protective equipment) is being appropriately used by all workers on site such as helmets, safety belts, and safety shoes. Ensure working platforms are sturdy enough, safety railings are fitted, all openings/ducts are closed appropriately, and electrical connections for equipment are done as per requirement.   6. Reporting and Billing and Review Performance   Prepare from time-to-time project reports and contractor's bills depending on the rules of the project management team or the company. Work status of the project. Budget for different stages of work. Cost for a selected time duration. Bill of contractors, etc. Review monthly work performance and quarterly work order performance of Contractors through evaluation forms on a quarterly basis Organize counseling sessions for poor-performing contractors. To prepare an abstract (Bill of measurement) of actual work executed on site and verify it is as per quality parameters mentioned in the work/contract order    7.   Provide all relevant data/updates about the project required for the planning and contract process   Give timely inputs to the Contract team about changes in the scope of the contract. Give input to planning dept. after comparing the actual resources mobilized/receivables with the planned ones on a weekly basis. Review daily/weekly progress reports (DPR & WPR) for an allotted set of buildings and intimate the Planning team in case of any discrepancy. Conduct weekly/monthly project progress review meetings.  8 .  Material wastage   Prepare optimum organizational structure i.e. functional and reporting matrix at the site level along with the deployment and release dates of the staff at the site. Monitor and review consumption reports against budgeted consumption. Any deviation from the budget should be investigated further.  Desired Candidate Profile   5 -10 Years/Real estate industry experience preferred/ Local Resident preferred/ Expertise in Strategic ERP project engineering module added advantage. Candidate should have commercial and High-rise Residential Building (RCC & Finishing) work experience.  Experienced In Bungalow projects preferred. Perks and Benefits   Salary and Benefits will be commensurate with qualifications & experience and will not be a limiting factor for deserving candidates. Bachelor Accommodation

column2: Location:  Nagpur Experience:  4-6 Years Education:  B.Tech / Diploma in Civil Engineering We are currently seeking a highly motivated Senior Engineer with expertise in building construction to join our team in Nagpur. The successful candidate will play a key role in the execution and management of building projects, ensuring adherence to quality standards, safety regulations, and project timelines. Responsibilities: Construction Management:  Assist in the planning, coordination, and execution of building construction projects under the guidance of the Project Manager. Site Supervision:  Oversee on-site activities, including construction progress, quality control, and safety compliance. Technical Support:  Provide technical expertise and guidance to project teams, subcontractors, and site personnel as needed. Material Procurement:  Assist in the procurement of construction materials, equipment, and services, ensuring timely delivery and cost-effectiveness. Quality Assurance:  Conduct inspections and quality checks to ensure that construction work meets project specifications and industry standards. Documentation:  Maintain accurate project documentation, including drawings, reports, and correspondence with stakeholders. Cost Control:  Monitor project expenses, identify cost-saving opportunities, and assist in budget management. Stakeholder Communication:  Communicate regularly with project stakeholders, providing updates on project progress, addressing concerns, and resolving issues. Safety Compliance:  Enforce safety protocols and regulations on-site to ensure a safe working environment for all personnel. Team Collaboration:  Collaborate effectively with project team members, subcontractors, and other stakeholders to achieve project objectives. Requirements: Bachelors degree or Diploma in Civil Engineering, with a focus on building construction. 4-6 years of experience in the construction industry, with hands-on experience in building projects. Strong technical knowledge of construction methods, materials, and building codes. Proficiency in project management tools and software. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to work effectively in a team environment and independently with minimal supervision. Attention to detail and problem-solving abilities. Willingness to travel to project sites and work flexible hours when necessary.
