column2: Design and Planning: Civil engineers are involved in the planning and design of various infrastructure projects such as roads, bridges, buildings, water supply and distribution systems, sewage systems, and more. They use engineering principles, mathematics, and computer-aided design (CAD) software to create detailed plans and specifications.       Construction and Project Management: Civil engineers oversee the construction phase of projects, ensuring that designs are executed accurately and safely. They manage construction teams, monitor progress, coordinate resources, and address any challenges that arise during construction.       Structural Engineering: Civil engineers specialize in structural engineering, which involves designing and analyzing the structural components of buildings, bridges, and other structures to ensure they can withstand loads and environmental conditions.       Geotechnical Engineering: Geotechnical engineers within civil engineering focus on the behavior of soil and rock materials to design foundations, slopes, and other structures that interact with the ground.       Transportation Engineering: Civil engineers in transportation design and plan transportation systems, including roads, highways, airports, and railways, with a focus on efficient traffic flow and safety.   Water Resources Engineering: Water resources engineers design and manage systems related to water supply, drainage, flood control, and wastewater treatment.       Environmental Engineering: Environmental engineers within civil engineering address the environmental impact of infrastructure projects, including waste management, pollution control, and sustainability considerations.
column11: Civil, DEC, Industrial construction, Senior Engineer Civil

column2: Job Description:  We are looking for a skilled Civil Engineer with at least 3 years of experience in construction to join our team remotely. The Civil Engineer will play a crucial role in overseeing and managing construction projects, ensuring they are completed safely, on time, and within budget while meeting quality standards. Responsibilities: Design and plan civil engineering aspects of construction projects, including site layout, grading, drainage, and utility systems. Prepare and review engineering drawings, specifications, and construction documents to ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and project specifications. Conduct site visits and surveys to assess project feasibility, identify potential challenges, and make recommendations for improvements or modifications. Collaborate with architects, project managers, and other stakeholders to develop project plans, schedules, and budgets, and ensure alignment with client objectives. Manage and oversee construction activities, including subcontractor coordination,      materials procurement, quality control, and safety compliance. Monitor  project progress, track expenses, and report on key performance indicators (KPIs) to stakeholders, providing regular updates and recommendations for optimization. Conduct engineering analyses, calculations, and simulations to evaluate structural      integrity, load capacities, and environmental impact, and propose solutions as needed. Review  and approve change orders, RFIs, and submittals, and address any design or      construction issues to maintain project timelines and quality standards. Collaborate  with regulatory agencies, obtain necessary permits and approvals, and ensure project compliance with building codes, zoning regulations, and environmental standards. Provide technical guidance and support to project teams, mentor junior engineers, and contribute to continuous improvement initiatives to enhance engineering processes and outcomes. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering or related field; Professional Engineer (PE) license preferred. Minimum of 3 years of experience as a Civil Engineer or similar role in the construction industry. Proficiency  in AutoCAD, Estimation softwares and other engineering software. Strong knowledge of engineering principles, construction methods, materials, and      regulations. Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills. Effective  communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate with multidisciplinary teams and stakeholders. Detail-oriented, organized, and able to prioritize tasks effectively in a fast-paced      environment. Familiarity with project management principles and software is a plus. Willingness to work remotely.
column11: Civil Engineering, Construction Management, Construction Engineering

column2: 1.	Designing infrastructure projects: The Civil Engineer must develop plans and designs for infrastructure projects, taking into account factors such as cost, safety, environmental impact, and construction feasibility.   2.	Analyzing data: The Civil Engineer must analyze data, such as survey reports, environmental impact studies, and geotechnical reports, to inform design decisions and ensure that projects meet relevant standards and regulations.   3.	Managing projects: The Civil Engineer must manage infrastructure projects from start to finish, including overseeing construction, coordinating with contractors and other stakeholders, and ensuring that projects are completed on time and within budget.   4.	Conducting site inspections: The Civil Engineer must conduct site inspections to ensure that construction work is being performed according to plans and specifications, and to identify and address any issues that arise.   5.	Ensuring safety and compliance: The Civil Engineer must ensure that infrastructure projects are designed and constructed to meet relevant safety standards and regulations, and that appropriate permits and approvals are obtained.   6.	Maintaining infrastructure: The Civil Engineer must oversee maintenance and repairs of existing infrastructure, ensuring that it remains safe and functional for its intended use.   To be successful as a Civil Engineer, candidates should have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, as well as excellent communication and project management skills. They should also have a solid understanding of engineering principles and practices, and be familiar with relevant regulations and standards.

column2: Manager (Civil)   Basic Job Description   We are seeking for Manager (Civil) who will be responsible for managing all civil engineering and construction activities related to the distillery facilities. You will play a crucial role in ensuring the structural integrity, safety, and compliance of the distillery's infrastructure. This position requires strong project management skills, a deep understanding of civil engineering principles, and the ability to collaborate with various stakeholders.   Duties and Responsibilities Project Management: Lead and manage civil engineering projects from conception to completion, ensuring they are delivered on time, within budget, and in compliance with regulatory standards. Develop project plans, schedules, and budgets, and regularly report progress to senior management. Infrastructure Design and Maintenance: Collaborate with architects and engineering teams to design, plan, and implement civil infrastructure projects for the distillery. Ensure the maintenance and repair of existing civil structures, including buildings, roads, drainage systems, and utilities. Compliance and Safety: Ensure all civil engineering activities adhere to local, state, and federal regulations, including building codes and safety standards. Implement and enforce safety protocols to create a secure work environment for all employees and contractors. Vendor and Contractor Management: Select, hire, and manage contractors, architects, and engineering firms for civil projects. Negotiate contracts, review proposals, and ensure that contractors deliver work according to agreed-upon specifications. Budget Oversight: Develop and manage budgets for civil engineering projects, ensuring cost-effectiveness and efficiency. Monitor expenses, identify cost-saving opportunities, and report budget variances to management. Risk Management: Identify potential risks related to civil engineering projects and develop mitigation strategies. Proactively address challenges to prevent project delays or cost overruns. Collaboration and Communication: Foster effective communication and collaboration with cross-functional teams, including production, maintenance, safety, and environmental teams. Report progress and updates to senior management and stakeholders regularly. Documentation and Reporting: Maintain accurate and up-to-date project documentation, including drawings, specifications, and reports. Provide regular reports on project status, milestones achieved, and potential challenges. Qualifications and Requirements Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering or a related field. Proven experience in civil engineering and project management, preferably in the industrial or distillery sector. Strong knowledge of construction methodologies, building codes, and safety regulations. Excellent organizational, leadership, and communication skills Job Location : BCL (Distillery Unit) Sangat Kalan, Bathinda (Punjab)

column2: Role & responsibilities     We are seeking a skilled Quality Control Engineer with 2-7 years of experience in civil and structural engineering within the oil and gas industry. The ideal candidate will be responsible for ensuring the quality and integrity of civil and structural components of projects, adhering to industry standards and regulations. Key Responsibilities: Perform quality control inspections and audits on civil and structural construction activities, ensuring compliance with project specifications, codes, and standards. Review and interpret engineering drawings, plans, and specifications to verify accuracy and completeness. Conduct material inspections and testing, including concrete, steel, and other construction materials, ensuring they meet quality requirements. Collaborate with project managers, engineers, and construction teams to resolve quality-related issues and implement corrective actions. Document and report non-conformances, deviations, and quality issues, and track resolution through to completion. Monitor and evaluate contractor performance to ensure adherence to quality control plans and procedures. Participate in pre-inspection meetings, progress meetings, and project reviews to provide input on quality-related matters. Maintain up-to-date knowledge of industry best practices, standards, and regulations related to civil and structural engineering in the oil and gas sector. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering or related field. 2-7 years of experience in quality control or quality assurance roles within the oil and gas industry, with a focus on civil and structural engineering. Strong understanding of construction methods, materials, and techniques relevant to civil and structural projects. Proficiency in interpreting engineering drawings, specifications, and standards. Experience with quality control tools and methodologies, such as inspections, audits, and testing procedures. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with multidisciplinary teams. Attention to detail and strong analytical skills for identifying and resolving quality issues. column2: JOB DESCRIPTION FOR CIVIL SUPERVISOR As a Senior Civil Engineer, your primary responsibility is to oversee and manage the construction and maintenance of civil engineering projects (MEP). You will be responsible for coordinating and supervising a team of workers to ensure that projects are completed safely on time, and within budget. Your role will involve a combination of technical skills and leadership abilities. Responsibilities: 1.  Project Planning:  Communicate with engineers and project managers to develop project plans, including timelines, resource requirements. 2.  Team Management:  Supervise and provide guidance to a team of construction workers, ensuring that they are aware of their tasks and responsibilities. Delegate work assignments and monitor progress to ensure adherence to project schedules. 3.  Construction Oversight:  Oversee the construction activities on-site. Conduct regular inspections to identify and address any issues or deviations from plans. 4.  Resource Coordination:  Coordinate the procurement and allocation of resources, such as materials, equipment, and manpower, necessary for the successful execution of projects. Ensure that all required resources are available and utilized efficiently. 5.  Safety Compliance:  Enforce strict adherence to safety protocols and regulations to maintain a safe working environment. 6.  Documentation and Reporting:  Maintain accurate and up-to-date project documentation, including progress reports, daily activity logs. Prepare timely reports on project status, including any challenges or issues encountered. 7.  Client Communication:  Liaise with project holders regarding bill and fund, including engineers, contractors to provide updates on project progress, address concerns, and ensure effective communication throughout the project lifecycle. 8.  Cost Control:  Monitor project expenses, track costs, and identify areas for cost optimization. 9.  Continuous Improvement:  Stay technological advancements in the field of civil engineering. Identify opportunities for process improvement and propose innovative solutions to enhance project efficiency and quality. Requirements: Bachelor's degree in any stream (Science preferred). Should have minimum 6 years exp. in civil supervision. At least complete one Govt. project (Preferred work in JJM). Proven experience as a Civil Supervisor or a similar role in the Govt. Infrastructures. Strong knowledge of civil construction & MEP. Excellent leadership and team management skills. Proficient in Computer knowledge. Sound understanding of Govt. liaise. Effective communication and interpersonal skills. Strong problem-solving and decision-making abilities. Ability to work under pressure and meet project deadlines. Attention to detail and a commitment to delivering the project on time.

column2: Job Title: Civil Engineer Company Overview:   :  Greencentric Commercial projects is a leading turnkey interior firm specializing in creating innovative and functional spaces for both commercial and residential clients. With a focus on excellence and creativity, we pride ourselves on delivering exceptional design solutions that exceed our clients' expectations. As we continue to expand our operations, we are seeking a skilled Civil Engineer to join our team. Job Overview:  As a Civil Engineer at Greencentric Commercial Projects, you will be responsible for overseeing various aspects of the construction process, from design and planning to execution and completion. Your expertise in 2D drafting, AutoCAD, and project management will be essential in ensuring that projects are completed on time, within budget, and to the highest standards of quality. Key Responsibilities: 2D Drafting:  Proficient in AutoCAD 2D to create accurate technical drawings, blueprints, and plans for construction projects. Office Layout Preparation:  Develop office layouts and site plans that optimize space utilization, workflow efficiency, and safety standards. Site Visits:  Conduct regular site visits to monitor construction progress, ensure adherence to design specifications, and address any on-site issues or modifications. Bill of Quantities (BOQ) Preparation:  Prepare detailed BOQs outlining the quantities and specifications of materials, equipment, and labor required for each project. Bill Verification and On-Site Bill Preparation:  Review contractor bills and invoices, verify the accuracy of charges, and prepare on-site bills as needed. Certification and Verification of Vendor Bill:  Certify and verify vendor bills for materials and services provided, ensuring compliance with contractual agreements and project budgets. Estimation and Costing:  Conduct cost estimations for construction projects, including material costs, labor costs, and overhead expenses. IGBC Certification and Documentation (Preferable):  Knowledge of IGBC certification requirements and documentation for sustainable construction practices. MS Excel Proficiency:  Utilize MS Excel for data analysis, cost tracking, and project management purposes. Efficient Client Communication:  Maintain effective communication with clients, contractors, and project stakeholders to provide updates, address concerns, and ensure client satisfaction throughout the project lifecycle.         Qualifications: Diploma in Civil Engineering (Junior Engineer) or BE Civil (Senior Engineer) from a recognized institution. Proven experience (2-5 years) working as a Civil Engineer in the construction industry/Turnkey Interiors. Proficiency in AutoCAD 2D and other relevant design software. Strong knowledge of construction methods, materials, and building codes. Excellent project management and organizational skills. Ability to work effectively in a team environment and independently. Knowledge of IGBC certification (preferable but not mandatory). Proficiency in MS Excel and other Microsoft Office applications. Benefits: Competitive salary based on experience and qualifications. Health insurance and other benefits package. Opportunities for professional development and advancement within the company. Dynamic and collaborative work environment with a focus on innovation and growth. Join [Company Name] and contribute to the success of exciting construction projects that make a positive impact on communities. Apply now to take the next step in your career as a Civil Engineer! Top of Form   Job Location : Andheri East ,Marol, Mumbai. Travelling : 50 %

column2: Job Title: Civil Engineer (Finishing Work) Location: Mumbai International Airport, Mumbai, India Company Overview: We are a leading construction company specializing in infrastructure projects, committed to delivering high-quality results. Currently, we are seeking a diligent and experienced Civil Engineer to oversee finishing work at the Mumbai International Airport project. Job Description: As a Civil Engineer specializing in finishing work, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the successful completion of the project at Mumbai International Airport. Your responsibilities will encompass supervision, coordination, and management of various aspects related to finishing work, including but not limited to architectural finishes, interior works, and landscaping. You will work closely with the user team to meet their requirements and ensure adherence to project specifications and timelines. Key Responsibilities: 1.Supervise and oversee finishing work activities at Mumbai International Airport construction site. 2.Coordinate with the user team to understand their requirements and ensure that finishing work aligns with their expectations. 3.Manage manpower allocation and deployment effectively to optimize productivity and meet project deadlines. 4.Monitor material requirements and ensure timely procurement and deployment to the site. 5.Conduct regular inspections to ensure quality standards are met and work is progressing according to schedule. 6.Address any issues or challenges that arise during the finishing work phase and implement appropriate solutions. 7.Collaborate with architects, contractors, and other stakeholders to resolve technical queries and ensure smooth execution of finishing work. 8.Maintain accurate records of work progress, material usage, and manpower deployment. Requirements: 1.Bachelors degree in Civil Engineering or a related field. 2.Proven experience in overseeing finishing work on large-scale construction projects, preferably in airport infrastructure. 3.Strong knowledge of construction methodologies, materials, and techniques related to finishing work. 4.Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to effectively coordinate with the user team, contractors, and other stakeholders. 5.Ability to manage and lead a team of workers and subcontractors.  6. Proficiency in project management tools and software. 7.Familiarity with relevant building codes, regulations, and safety standards. 8.Problem-solving skills and the ability to work well under pressure. Preferred Qualifications: 1.Masters degree in Civil Engineering or a related field. 2.Professional certification or licensure as a Civil Engineer. 3.Previous experience working on airport construction projects. 4.Knowledge of sustainability practices in construction. Benefits: Competitive salary commensurate with experience and qualifications. Opportunities for professional development and advancement within the company. A dynamic and collaborative work environment. If you possess the required qualifications and are passionate about contributing to the successful completion of the Mumbai International Airport project, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.

column2: Designing infrastructure projects: The Civil Engineer must develop plans and designs for infrastructure projects, taking into account factors such as cost, safety, environmental impact, and construction feasibility.     Analyzing data: The Civil Engineer must analyze data, such as survey reports, environmental impact studies, and geotechnical reports, to inform design decisions and ensure that projects meet relevant standards and regulations.     Managing projects: The Civil Engineer must manage infrastructure projects from start to finish, including overseeing construction, coordinating with contractors and other stakeholders, and ensuring that projects are completed on time and within budget.     Conducting site inspections: The Civil Engineer must conduct site inspections to ensure that construction work is being performed according to plans and specifications, and to identify and address any issues that arise.     Ensuring safety and compliance: The Civil Engineer must ensure that infrastructure projects are designed and constructed to meet relevant safety standards and regulations, and that appropriate permits and approvals are obtained.     Maintaining infrastructure: The Civil Engineer must oversee maintenance and repairs of existing infrastructure, ensuring that it remains safe and functional for its intended use.To be successful as a Civil Engineer, candidates should have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, as well as excellent communication and project management skills. They should also have a solid understanding of engineering principles and practices, and be familiar with relevant regulations and standards.

column2: Role & responsibilities: Outlin Job Description We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced individual with over 10 years of experience in civil engineering, particularly in project management, to lead our Civil Engineering department as the Head of Civil Engineering. As the Head of Civil Engineering, you will oversee all aspects of civil engineering projects, manage a team of engineers and technicians, and ensure the successful completion of projects within budget and on schedule. Responsibilities 1. Project Management- Lead and manage civil engineering projects from inception to completion, ensuring adherence to project specifications, timelines, and budget constraints. 2. Team Leadership- Provide leadership, guidance, and mentorship to a team of civil engineers, designers, and technicians, fostering a collaborative and innovative work environment. 3. Strategic Planning - Develop and implement strategic plans to enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of the Civil Engineering department, aligning with the company's overall goals and objectives. 4. Resource Allocation - Allocate resources effectively to optimize project outcomes, including personnel, equipment, and materials. 5. Quality Assurance - Ensure the highest standards of quality and compliance with regulatory requirements in all civil engineering projects. 6. Client Relationship Management - Cultivate and maintain strong relationships with clients, understanding their needs and expectations, and ensuring their satisfaction with project deliverables. 7. Risk Management - Identify potential risks and challenges in civil engineering projects and implement proactive measures to mitigate them. 8. Budget Management - Develop and manage project budgets, monitor expenditures, and implement cost-saving measures where possible. 9. Innovation and Research - Stay abreast of industry trends, best practices, and technological advancements in civil engineering, and integrate innovative solutions into project designs and processes. 10. Collaboration- Collaborate with other departments within the organization to ensure seamless integration and coordination of interdisciplinary projects. 11. Travelling - visit the different sites to oversee there is no project cost overrun. The candidate shall be ok with frequent travels. 12. Plans, assigns, supervises, and reviews Structural-Design/ Architectural/ MEP-Design/ Quantity Survey for planning, designing, cost estimating. 13. Develop working method based on QMS and other given guidelines. 14. Carry out technical and feasibility studies and draw up blueprints that satisfy technical specifications. 15. Expertise in AutoCAD, familiarity with codes and structures issued by Bureau of Indian Standards (BIS) relevant to civil engineering disciplines such as IS 456 for concrete, IS 800 for steel structures and IS 893 for seismic design. Qualifications: 1. Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering; Master's degree preferred. 2. Minimum of 10 years of experience in civil engineering, with a proven track record of managing complex projects. 3. Strong project management skills, including experience in leading and coordinating teams. 4. Excellent leadership and team management skills, with the ability to inspire and motivate a diverse team of professionals. 5. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively interact with clients, stakeholders, and team members at all levels. 6. Proficiency in project management software and other relevant tools. 7. In-depth knowledge of civil engineering principles, practices, and regulations. 8. Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities, with a keen attention to detail. 9. Commitment to continuous learning and professional development. Benefits Competitive Salary and Benefits as per Industry standard Opportunity to spearhead one of India's best Real Estate companies e the day-to-day responsibilities for this role. Preferred candidate profile: Specify required role expertise, previous job experience, or relevant certifications. Perks and benefits: Mention available facilities and benefits the company is offering with this job.

Client Communication:  Effectively communicating complex engineering concepts to clients, addressing concerns, and ensuring their expectations align with project deliverables. Continuous Learning and Adaptation:  Post-B.Tech, staying abreast of industry advancements, incorporating new technologies, and adapting skills to ensure projects meet contemporary standards and challenges.  JUNIOR ENGINEER RESPONSIBILITIES- To help senior engineers in designing, planning, and overseeing construction projects. Conducting site visits and surveys to collect the data as per project requirements. Creating detailed drawings, plans, and specifications of projects using computer-aided design (CAD) software. Preparing cost estimation and material requirements reports for specific projects. Monitoring work progress, quality, and compliance with building codes and regulations. column2: Job Title: Civil Supervisor Location:  GLA University Mathura Experience:  7-14 years Position Type:  Full-Time Job Summary:  The University Civil Engineer is a key member of the campus development team responsible for planning, designing, and managing various civil engineering projects on the university campus. This role requires a highly skilled and experienced civil engineer who can oversee the construction and maintenance of infrastructure, ensuring safety, compliance, and efficiency while enhancing the campus environment. The University is an equal opportunity employer and encourages candidates of all backgrounds to apply.   This Civil Engineer position offers an exciting opportunity to contribute to the development and improvement of the university's campus infrastructure. If you are a dedicated and experienced civil engineer with a passion for enhancing educational environments, we invite you to apply and become part of our dynamic campus development team.  Key Responsibilities: Project Planning and Management: Plan, coordinate, and manage civil engineering projects from conception to completion, ensuring they align with the university's objectives and regulations. Develop project scopes, budgets, and timelines while identifying potential risks and mitigation strategies. 2.  Design and Documentation: Prepare detailed engineering plans, specifications, and drawings for infrastructure projects, including roads, utilities, drainage systems, and buildings' foundation. Ensure designs comply with local building codes, safety standards, and sustainability principles. 3.  Construction Oversight: Oversee construction activities, providing guidance to contractors, monitoring progress, and addressing any issues that may arise. Ensure projects are completed on time, within budget, and to the required quality standards. 4.  Quality Assurance and Compliance: Conduct inspections and quality checks to guarantee compliance with engineering designs and safety standards. Stay up-to-date with relevant regulations, permits, and licensing requirements, and ensure the university remains compliant. 5.  Budget Management: Develop and manage project budgets, monitoring expenses, and cost-control measures. Seek cost-effective solutions while maintaining high-quality project outcomes. 6.  Environmental Sustainability: Implement sustainable and eco-friendly practices in civil engineering projects, such as rainwater harvesting, green infrastructure, and energy-efficient design. 7.  Collaboration and Stakeholder Engagement: Collaborate with university departments, architects, contractors, and regulatory agencies to facilitate the successful execution of projects. Communicate project updates and progress to university leadership and other stakeholders. 8.  Documentation and Reporting: Maintain accurate project records, including all plans, contracts, change orders, and project reports. Generate regular progress reports and provide updates to the Director of Campus Development. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering; Master's degree preferred. Professional Engineer (PE) license is required. 5-12 years of experience in civil engineering, with a focus on project management. Proficiency in civil engineering design software and AutoCAD. Strong knowledge of local building codes, regulations, and safety standards. Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills. Effective communication and interpersonal skills. Proven ability to lead and manage project teams.

column2: Quality Standards: Develop, implement, and maintain quality standards, procedures, and guidelines for products or processes     Inspections: Conduct inspections, audits, and tests to ensure that products or projects meet quality and compliance requirements     Quality Control: Monitor and control production or project processes to minimize defects and maintain quality standards     Documentation: Maintain detailed records of inspections, test results, and quality control measures     Defect Identification: Identify and report defects, non-conformities, or discrepancies, and work with teams to resolve issues     Root Cause Analysis: Investigate and analyze the root causes of quality issues and implement corrective and preventive actions (CAPA)     Process Improvement: Identify opportunities for process improvements and efficiency enhancements to maintain and enhance product or project quality     Training: Provide training to staff and teams on quality control and quality assurance best practices     Skills and Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in engineering or a related field     Knowledge of quality management systems, standards, and methodologies (eg, ISO 9001)     Familiarity with quality tools and techniques, such as Six Sigma or Lean     Strong analytical and problem-solving skills     Attention to detail and a commitment to quality

column2: As a Highway Engineer, your role is to design, plan, and oversee the construction, maintenance, and improvement of highways, roads, and transportation infrastructure      You work on projects that involve the design and construction of new highways, as well as the rehabilitation and expansion of existing roadways      Here are some key responsibilities and tasks typically associated with the role of a Highway Engineer:Highway Design: Designing highways and roadways, including alignment, cross-sections, and geometric layouts      You consider factors such as traffic volume, speed limits, safety standards, and environmental impact to develop optimal designs      Traffic Analysis and Planning: Analyzing traffic patterns, conducting traffic studies, and forecasting future traffic demands to inform highway design and planning decisions      You consider factors such as traffic flow, capacity analysis, and intersection design to optimize traffic efficiency and safety        Pavement Design and Rehabilitation:        Designing and specifying pavement materials and thicknesses to ensure durability and safety      You assess pavement conditions, conduct structural analysis, and determine appropriate rehabilitation or reconstruction strategies      Drainage Design: Designing drainage systems, including culverts, stormwater management, and erosion control measures, to ensure proper water flow and prevent flooding or erosion along highways      Construction Supervision: Overseeing highway construction projects to ensure compliance with design specifications, quality standards, and safety regulations      You coordinate with contractors, monitor construction progress, and resolve any issues or challenges that arise during construction      Traffic Safety and Highway Operations: Implementing traffic control measures, signage, and markings to enhance safety and traffic flow on highways      You consider factors such as intersection design, signage placement, and traffic signal coordination to optimize highway operations      Environmental Considerations: Assessing and addressing environmental impacts associated with highway construction and operations      You evaluate potential impacts on air quality, noise pollution, and natural habitats, and develop mitigation strategies to minimize environmental harm      Project Management: Managing highway projects from inception to completion      This involves developing project plans, estimating costs, preparing bid documents, and overseeing project schedules and budgets      You collaborate with stakeholders, such as government agencies and local communities, to ensure project objectives are met

column2: Manager Civil Execution ?Construction for PAN India retail store development involves overseeing and managing various aspects of construction projects.? ? ?Responsibilities may include: ?1. **Project Planning: ** Develop comprehensive project plans, timelines for retail store construction projects across India. 2. **Team Management:** Lead and supervise construction teams, contractors, and vendors to ensure efficient and timely project delivery. 3. **Quality Control:** Ensure construction activities meet quality standards and comply with relevant regulations and codes. 4. **Cost Management:** Monitor and control project costs, ensuring adherence to budgetary constraints and identifying cost-saving opportunities. 5. **Site Inspections:** Conduct regular site visits to inspect construction progress, address issues, and ensure alignment with project specifications. 6. **Contract Negotiation:** Engage in negotiations with contractors, suppliers, and other stakeholders to secure favorable terms and conditions. 7. **Risk Management:** Identify potential risks and develop mitigation strategies to minimize disruptions and delays in project execution. 8. **Collaboration:** Coordinate with cross-functional teams, including design, procurement, and operations, to ensure seamless integration of construction activities. 9. **Compliance:** Ensure compliance with all relevant legal, safety, and environmental regulations throughout the construction process. 10. **Reporting:** Provide regular updates and reports on project status, highlighting key milestones, challenges, and resolutions to senior management. 11. **Timeline Adherence:** Strive to meet project timelines and deadlines, implementing corrective measures when necessary. 12. **Vendor Management:** Manage relationships with construction contractors, suppliers, and service providers to foster collaboration and achieve project goals. 13. **Problem Resolution:** Address and resolve construction-related issues promptly to keep projects on track. 14. **Cost-Benefit Analysis:** Conduct cost-benefit analyses to assess the financial impact of decisions and optimize resource allocation. These roles require a blend of leadership, technical knowledge, and project management skills to successfully drive the construction of retail stores across diverse locations in India Managing 1-2 projects within state Job Location- Madhya Pradesh/Chhattisgarh Education- BE Civil/ Btech Civil Experience- 6-12years If you Interested for this job role then share your update cv on  project.hr2@dmartindia.com

column2: Job Description:  We are seeking a dedicated and proactive Safety Engineer to join our team. The ideal candidate will have 2-3 years of experience in occupational health and safety, with a strong commitment to promoting and maintaining a safe work environment. The Safety Engineer will be responsible for implementing and enforcing safety policies and procedures to ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and industry best practices. Responsibilities: Conduct regular safety inspections and audits of work sites, facilities, and equipment to identify hazards and ensure compliance with safety regulations. Develop and implement safety programs, training, and initiatives to promote awareness and reduce the risk of accidents, injuries, and occupational illnesses. Provide guidance and support to employees and management on safety-related issues, including hazard identification, risk assessment, and incident investigation. Monitor and enforce compliance with company safety policies, procedures, and regulatory requirements, including OSHA standards. Participate in safety committee meetings, toolbox talks, and other forums to communicate safety information and promote a safety-conscious culture. Investigate accidents, incidents, and near misses to determine root causes and recommend corrective actions to prevent recurrence. Maintain accurate records and documentation related to safety inspections, training, incidents, and corrective actions. Conduct emergency response drills and exercises to test and improve the effectiveness of emergency procedures. Stay up-to-date on industry trends, regulatory changes, and emerging best practices in occupational health and safety.
column11: Knowledge of Safety Regulations, HSE Training, OHSAS 18001, Industrial Safety, Safety Engineering, Safety Management, Safety Inspection, Safety Analysis, Construction Safety

Data Collection: Conduct field surveys using advanced surveying instruments and technologies, such as total stations, GPS receivers, and aerial drones      Measure distances, angles, elevations, and contours to determine the precise location and shape of land features and boundaries      Boundary Determination: Identify and establish property boundaries, easements, right-of-ways, and land titles areas      Data Processing and Analysis: Process, analyze, and interpret survey data using specialized software applications, such as CAD (Computer-Aided Design), GIS (Geographic Information Systems), and surveying software      Generate digital maps, drawings, and reports to document survey findings and conclusions      Quality Assurance: Conduct quality control checks and audits to verify the requirements

column2: Job description  :-   Role Summary : Project Manager would be responsible for end to end of execution for the projects (including billing work design, estimation, construction). Expectations from the Role: Managing the end to end of execution at site estimation, project planning, scheduling, deploying, monitoring, construction, and delivery Key Deliverables: - Manage entire project from financials and timelines point of view - Schedule deliverables and ensure timely delivery  - Coordination with internal & external stakeholders as well as clients on all aspects of execution - Ensuring best in class quality and safety standards - Analyze and report the cost / time schedule /overruns from time to time and take appropriate measures - Resource Planning, Materials Management, Contract Management and Safety Management   Candidate Profile: - PG in Construction Management / Project Management AND B.E / B.Tech (Civil) or equivalent - Minimum 12 yrs of experience in construction management/project management and presently handling similar role. -- Candidates with strategic bent of mind, high on proactiveness and flexibility would be ideal fit to this role.     Roles and Responsibilities   Project managers  oversee the planning and delivery of  construction projects . They ensure that work is completed on time and within budget. They organize logistics, delegate work and keep track of spending. He has to play the lead  role  in planning, executing, monitoring, controlling and closing  projects . They are accountable for the entire  project  scope,  project  team, resources, and the success of the  project .   EXTRA Project planning. ... Oversee construction personnel. ... Prepare progress reports. ... Communication skills. ... Organisational skills. ... Risk management They supervise subcontractors, attend project progress meeting and monitor compliance with building and safety codes and regulations Providing leadership in planning,  Organizing and Controlling the work effort to accomplish the construction project objectives Responsibilities Collaborate with engineers, architects etc. to determine the specifications of the project   Negotiate contracts with external vendors to reach profitable agreements Obtain permits and licenses from appropriate authorities Determine needed resources (manpower, equipment and materials) from start to finish with attention to budgetary limitations Plan all construction operations and schedule intermediate phases to ensure deadlines will be met Acquire equipment and material and monitor stocks to timely handle inadequacies Hire contractors and other staff and allocate responsibilities Supervise the work of laborers, mechanics etc. and give them guidance when needed Evaluate progress and prepare detailed reports Ensure adherence to all health and safety standards and report issues Requirements and skills Proven experience as construction project manager In-depth understanding of construction procedures and material and project management principles Familiarity with quality and health and safety standards Good knowledge of MS Office Familiarity with construction/ project management software Outstanding communication and negotiation skills Excellent organizational and time-management skills A team player with leadership abilities BSc/BA in engineering, building science or relevant field PMP or equivalent certification will be an advantage   Project Experience in Industrial Commercial Residential

column2: Job Description: We are seeking an experienced Senior Modeler proficient in Tekla Structures software to join our team. As a Senior Modeler, you will play a key role in the structural design and detailing process, ensuring accuracy, efficiency, and adherence to project requirements. Responsibilities: Create detailed structural models using Tekla Structures software. Collaborate with engineers and designers to develop accurate models based on project specifications and design requirements. Review architectural and engineering drawings to identify and resolve potential conflicts or discrepancies. Generate fabrication drawings, shop drawings, and other construction documents as required. Conduct model coordination and clash detection to ensure constructability and minimize conflicts during the construction phase. Provide guidance and mentorship to junior modelers as needed. Stay updated on industry trends, software updates, and best practices related to structural modeling and detailing.   Requirements: Bachelor's degree in Civil Engineering, Structural Engineering, or a related field. Minimum 3-8 years of experience in structural modeling using Tekla Structures software. Proficiency in creating detailed models, fabrication drawings, and construction documents. Strong understanding of structural engineering principles and construction practices. Excellent communication and collaboration skills. Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple projects simultaneously. Experience with BIM (Building Information Modeling) and coordination workflows is a plus. Benefits: Deserved for right candidate(Relocation Expenses, Timely benefits ) Interested and eligible candidates please do share resumes to vjahr@moldtekindia.com

column2: Title: Structural Revit Modeler  Location: Pune or Bangalore  Domain: Greenhouses  Job Description:   As a Structural Revit Modeler tasked with setting up the library, you play a crucial role in ensuring that  Revit projects are efficient, consistent, and adhere to industry standards. By establishing a robust and  organized Revit library for structural modeling, you are facilitating more efficient and consistent project  workflows.  Job Requirements:  ??Bachelors in Structural Engineering (prefered) / Civil Engineering with differentiation constructions  ??6-8 years of work experience with AutoCAD  Revit  ?? Expertise in smart families .  ??Extensive experience and proficient with Revit - creating smart families.  ??Experience in steel constructions.  ??Familiar with international standards in engineering and experience working with international  clients.  ??Experience in doing research and giving advice.  Job Responsibilities:  Roles and responsibilities  1. Understand Project Requirements:  ??Identify the types of projects the organization undertakes.  ??Understand the specific structural components and details commonly used in your projects.  2. Create a Standardized Folder Structure:  ??Develop a clear and organized folder structure for your library. For example:  o Families: Store Revit families (.rfa files) categorized by types (columns, beams, braces,  etc.)  o Details: Include typical details and section views  o Materials: Store standard structural materials  o Templates: Include project templates with predefined settings  o Shared Parameters: Define and store shared parameters in an organized manner.  3. Develop and Organize Revit Families:  ??Create or gather standard Revit families based on your organization's needs.  ??Categorize families logically to make them easy to find.  ??Ensure families follow industry standards and the organization's specific requirements.  4. Use Shared Parameters:  ??Establish a set of shared parameters for consistency across all families.  ??Include parameters for information relevant to structural analysis and documentation.  5. Detail Components:  ??Develop standard detail components that can be easily inserted into sheets.  ??Ensure details adhere to industry standards and are adjustable to fit various scales.  6. Materials Library:  ??Set up a library of standard materials commonly used in structural projects.  ??Include information such as material properties and appearance for accurate representation  in renderings.  7. Templates:  ??Create project templates with predefined views, sheets, and schedules.  ??Ensure that the templates are set up to align with your organization's standards.  8. Document Library:  ??Include standard documentation templates for consistency in project documentation.  ??Store standard sheets for common project types.  9. Coordinate with Other Disciplines:  ??Collaborate with architectural, MEP, and other teams to ensure that the library is  comprehensive and supports interdisciplinary coordination.  10. Regular Updates:  ??Schedule regular reviews and updates to the library to incorporate new industry standards or  internal improvements.  11. Version Control:  ??Implement a version control system to track changes to the library and ensure everyone is  using the latest versions.

column2: Role & responsibilities   We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Project Coordinator to join our team for a prestigious  high-rise luxury residential project in the Suburbs. The ideal candidate will possess technical expertise in  RCC structures, finishes, MEPF trades coordination, as well as a thorough understanding of site logistics,  planning, risk management, and strategy for fast-track construction techniques and innovative  construction methods. The Project Coordinator will play a crucial role in ensuring the successful execution  of the project from inception to completion.   1. Technical Coordination: - Coordinate with architects, engineers, consultants, and contractors to ensure proper coordination of  RCC structures, finishes, MEPF trades, and other technical aspects. - Review construction drawings, specifications, and documents to identify and resolve any discrepancies  or conflicts. - Monitor the progress of consultant deliverables in line with Project Master Schedule and ongoing  construction activities and ensure adherence to quality standards and project specifications.  2. Site Logistics and Planning: - Develop and implement site logistics plans to optimize the use of resources, equipment, and manpower. - Coordinate with site management teams to plan and schedule construction activities, material deliveries,  and equipment mobilization. - Anticipate and mitigate potential construction-related challenges and obstacles to ensure smooth  project execution.  3. Strategy for Fast-Track Construction Techniques: - Identify opportunities for implementing fast-track construction techniques to expedite project timelines  while maintaining quality and safety standards. - Collaborate with project stakeholders to develop innovative construction methods and strategies to  enhance efficiency and productivity.  4. Formwork Planning: - Evaluate and select appropriate types of formwork systems based on project requirements, structural  design, and construction methodology. - Develop formwork plans and schedules to ensure timely installation, removal, and reusability of  formwork systems.  5. Risk Management: - Identify potential risks and uncertainties associated with the project and develop risk mitigation  strategies. - Conduct regular risk assessments and implement measures to minimize the impact of identified risks on  project objectives. - Collaborate with project stakeholders to ensure compliance with safety regulations and protocols to  mitigate construction-related risks.    Preferred candidate profile   Minimum of 8 to 13 Years of experience in project coordination or management,  preferably in high-rise residential construction projects. Strong technical knowledge of RCC structures,  finishes, MEPF trades, and construction methods. Proficiency in project management software and tools. Excellent communication, leadership, and interpersonal skills.

column2: A Field Surveyor is responsible for collecting data and measurements from various outdoor locations to create accurate maps, plans, and land descriptions     They use specialized equipment and techniques to gather information about land, property boundaries, and other geographic features     Responsibilities:Data Collection: Conduct field surveys to collect precise measurements, data, and observations using surveying equipment such as total stations, GPS receivers, levels, and drones     Land Boundary Analysis: Determine property boundaries and land contours, resolving boundary disputes when necessary     Map Creation: Create maps, charts, and diagrams using collected data, and prepare survey reports and documentation     Construction Surveys: Perform construction surveys to stake out reference points and ensure the accurate placement of structures, roads, and utilities     Topographic Surveys: Conduct topographic surveys to gather information about the terrain, including elevation, contours, and natural features     Legal Compliance: Ensure that all surveying activities comply with local, state, and federal laws and regulations     Client Interaction: Communicate with clients to understand project requirements, provide progress updates, and address any concerns or questions     Equipment Maintenance: Maintain and calibrate surveying equipment to ensure accuracy and reliability     Safety: Follow safety protocols and guidelines to minimize risks while working in outdoor environments     Team Collaboration: Collaborate with other surveyors, engineers, and professionals on larger projects that require integrated surveying and mapping efforts
column11: Field Surveyor

column2: We have immediate opening for AutoCAD/Civil 3D Technicians with a minimum of three (3) years of experience with AutoCAD Civil 3D Current Version. This position is responsible for developing engineered construction plans on an AutoCAD/CIVIL3D platform, receiving roughly designed concepts from engineers, and transforming them into working documents for civil engineering projects. The AutoCAD Civil 3D Technician will work under the direction of a Project Engineer. The AutoCAD Civil 3D Technician assists the Project Engineer with drafting sewer drains, storm drains, stormwater devices, earthworks plans, cut and fill plans, erosion/sediment control structures, carpark and driveway design, and small road improvements.      This role is orientated around assisting the Civil Engineering Design Team in developing and preparing land for residential and commercial developments. In this role, you will coordinate with other project consultants when designing driveways, carparks, roads, drainage, earthworks, and utility supply plans. You will grow into your role as an integral, valued and important member of our team. For an attentive and ambitious professional a pathway can be made available for leadership position in future.      Primary Duties :        This position is responsible for understanding and completing drawings in accordance with project specifications.          Creating a preliminary and/or final sketch of proposed drawings, using computer assisted design/drafting equipment.          Modifying drawings as directed by project engineer or design coordinator.          Work closely with other team members, architectural designers, and engineers to insure a coordinated design.          Performing miscellaneous job related duties involving drafting, simple technical calculations etc. as necessary.        Experience :        The successful candidate must have at least working experience of 3+years in Civil Engineering, with minimum 2 years of using Civil 3D software.          Proficient knowledge of AUTOCAD with demonstrated experience using CIVIL3D (Current Version)          Experience with drawing setup, scale usage, dimensioning, labelling, and plotting within a 2D & 3D environment.        Required Education :        Bachelor of Engineering in Civil, Bachelor of Engineering Technology in Civil, Bachelor of Science in Civil Engineering, Masters in Civil Engineering, or related qualifications.        Technical Skills in Civil 3D Software :        We expect that you have intermediate to senior level of proficiency in most of the software skills listed below.        Lot gradings, creating surfaces, modelling surface as per design requirements, earthworks cut and fill material estimates, creating alignments, corridor assembly and working with corridors, creating roads/carparks, creating pipe networks, plan and section view generations, plan production by exporting from Civil 3d and using basic AutoCAD.          Qualification:    Bachelor of Engineering in Civil            Years of Experience:    3 to 5+ yrs

column2: TRIBECA is a contemporary and vibrant real estate brand that brought the Trump Organization to India and pioneered the concept of branded residences.  Join us in our mission to create world-class real estate and customer experiences. Be a part of the Tribeca team and help us shape the future of luxury real estate in India.    Designation -  Manager - Quality  Website -  https://www.tribecadevelopers.com/ News -  https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/industry/services/property-/-cstruction/tribeca-inks-pact-for-prime-project-in-mumbais-parel-secures-hdfc-capital-funding/articleshow/106697586.cms?from=mdr Experience: 12+ Years  Skillsets: QMS, QA, QC, Testing, QA Audit. Location: South Bombay  What this job involves:  QMS Implementation  Prepare all quality document like test register, Checklist etc. Responsibility for quality assurance and quality control at the project site and report to the HOD in the issue related to non-conformance and deficiencies in the quality management process at the site. Assist the HOD in overall quality control of the site, provided advice and suggestion to improve quality control at construction site.  Responsible for co-ordination amongst various contractor's & respective project consultants.  Adapting New Checklist, In process checking, Inspection for all incoming material with testing, compute the work as per the specification, maintaining ISO documents.  Conducting tool box talk with contractor staff and labor, at the time of starting any new activity.  Preparing and maintaining Quality monthly report. Pre qualification fir all the vendors and contractors. Preparing and maintained project quality plan.  Education -  B.E/ B.Tech (Full Time) Must-have:  Experience in Residential luxury project sales across Mumbai Highly preferred   About the company   Tribeca is the largest branded luxury developer in India! Established in 2012, we have grown to become the largest developer of Trump-branded properties in the world (after the Trump Organization). Our current employee strength comprises more than 150 associates across Mumbai, Pune, Delhi-NCR, Kolkata, and Bangalore, and we have a team of incredibly talented, hungry, bright, and passionate folks, including IIT, IIM, Wharton, and SPA toppers and industry stalwarts.     At Tribeca, we are focused on creating world-class products and customer experiences. We pioneered the concept of branded residences in India and are developing over 6 million square feet of branded residential projects in India. We are also proud to be developing the world's largest rooftop terrace. We believe in contributing towards a sustainable environment and are committed to developing responsible homes that are energy efficient and use materials and resources that do not cause a negative impact on the environment.

Managing, monitoring and interpreting the contract design documents supplied by the client or architect; Liaising with any consultants, subcontractors, supervisors, planners, quantity surveyors and the general workforce involved in the project; Liaising with the local authority (where appropriate to the project) to ensure compliance with local construction regulations and by-laws; Liaising with clients and their representatives (architects, engineers and surveyors), including attending regular meetings to keep them informed of progress; Day-to-day management of the site, including supervising and monitoring the site labour force and the work of any subcontractors; Planning the work and efficiently organizing the plant and site facilities in order to meet agreed deadlines; Overseeing quality control and health and safety matters on site; Preparing reports as required; Liaising with the project planning engineer regarding construction programmes Checking materials and work in progress for compliance with the specified requirements Observance of safety requirements, make sure at all times that Safety instructions given by safety engineer are adhered to and in no ways compromised. Resolving technical issues with employers representatives, suppliers, subcontractors and statutory authorities Quality control in accordance with relevant IS Codes procedures method statements, quality plans and inspection and test plans, all prepared by the project management team and by subcontractors Liaising with company or project purchasing department to ensure that purchase orders adequately define the specified requirements Supervising and counselling junior or trainee engineers Measurement and valuation (in collaboration with the project quantity surveyor where appropriate) Providing data in respect of variation orders and site instructions Preparing record drawings, technical reports, site diary Job review of subordinate staff Infra project experiance is prefferable . column2: Role & responsibilities:   Design Development:  Assist in the development of design plans and specifications for infrastructure projects, including site layout, grading, drainage, utilities, and roadways. Construction Oversight:  Provide on-site support during the construction phase, including conducting site inspections, reviewing contractor submittals, and addressing technical issues as they arise. Quantity Takeoffs and Cost Estimation:  Perform quantity takeoffs and cost estimations for various project components to support budget development and cost tracking. Quality Assurance/Quality Control (QA/QC):  Implement QA/QC procedures to monitor construction activities and ensure adherence to design specifications and quality standards. Project Coordination:  Coordinate with internal teams, consultants, contractors, and regulatory agencies to facilitate smooth project execution and timely delivery. Risk Management:  Identify potential risks and develop mitigation strategies to minimize project delays, cost overruns, and other adverse impacts. Documentation and Reporting:  Maintain accurate project documentation, including drawings, reports, correspondence, and change orders. Prepare progress reports and updates for internal and external stakeholders. Basic understanding of engineering principles, AutoCAD proficiency, attention to detail. Clear communication skills to interact with senior engineers and project teams. Ability to assist in solving engineering challenges and proposing solutions.  Basic knowledge of relevant software and tools used in engineering design and analysis.  Ability to learn and adapt to new tasks and responsibilities.    Note: Job location will be Nalasopara and candidates from western line will be preferred.

column2: Position Summary: Bentley Systems is seeking a talented individual to become a valued member of our successful Civil Infrastructure team as a  Civil Engineering Consultant .  A Consultant plays an important role in delivering training, consulting and configuration services on Bentleys Civil Engineering Design applications. A Consultant is responsible for analysing our software users business and technical requirements and developing solutions that meet those needs.   Your Day-to-Day: Deliver consulting, configuration, and training services on Bentleys Civil Engineering Design applications to existing and new software users. Provide transition between versions of Bentley Civil Engineering Design applications. Configure Bentley Civil Engineering Design applications to project specifications. Assist in preparation of technical proposals and benchmarks. Perform software product training activities, project assessments, reviews, and audits. Collaborate with product development groups to continually improve the quality of the product based on user input. Serve as the primary liaison between company and software users. Develop and conduct technical presentations to existing and prospective users. Create learning content in the form of written documentation, videos and webinars. This role requires communication with Managers, peers and other colleagues of the company in person or by utilizing Microsoft Teams chat, calling and meeting functions. Requires sitting or standing at will while performing work on a computer.   What You Bring to The Team: Bachelor?? degree in civil engineering or closely related degree required.  Minimum 5 years??industry experience in the survey, road, drainage industry is required. Experience with the following Bentley software is preferred: MicroStation, OpenRoads Designer, GEOPAK, and/or InRoads.  Experience with other related industry civil engineering software such as Civil3D, MX, Trimble is beneficial. The ability to travel domestically or internationally approximately 20% of the time is required. Fluency in English is required. Excellent written and oral communication as well as strong presentation skills are required. Strong command of the English language with clear speaking skills for recording videos and teaching live training classes. Ability to learn and effectively demonstrate, configure, present training and consult on the Bentley Civil Engineering Design application. Ability to work on significant professional services projects with little supervision and lead others when needed. Experience with and knowledge of transportation agencies??planning, design and construction workflows.

column2: The Civil/Structural Designer provides solutions to problems in the Civil/Structural Design discipline without supervisory approval and will evaluate and select solutions from established operating procedures and/or scientific procedures.        Essential Qualifications & Education:          High School graduate with a diploma in Civil or Mechanical Design or Drafting in a related discipline      2 years minimum experience with major offshore contractor or consultant of which 10 years of experience in predominately offshore oil and gas structures      Detailed knowledge of associated industry detailing standards. Detailed knowledge of 3D and 2D drafting systems (2D: AutoCAD and MicroStation). Minimum 4 years working experience in S3D, E3D, 2D Draft, M.S.Office & Navis works.      Knowledge of QA Systems and a good communicator. Detailed knowledge of Auto lisp Programming, PDMS Model creation, Menu and/or Macro compilation skills would be an advantage.      Knowledge of offshore design specifications (e.g. QG, QP, NOC, Shell DEP etc.) & offshore design codes (API, AWS, AISC, ISO, DNV etc.)          Key Tasks and Responsibilities:          Ensure design deliverables are completed and issued per project specifications, MDR and project procedures, and within agreed schedules      Apply knowledge and/or skills to complete a variety of day-to-day activities within own area      Prioritize and organize own work to meet agreed upon deadlines      Become fully familiar with the Contract Scope of Work, specifications, schedule and all interdiscipline requirements; including identifying concerns as early as practicable and taking appropriate initiatives to address the issues      Interface with all disciplines to develop clash free designs      Interface with other disciplines to obtain input for Discipline designs and drawings      Participate in finalizing deliverables lists, deliverables and philosophies to ensure compliance with specifications and functional integrity      Set up and maintain the Discipline Master Design drawing and document files, including final archiving      Prepare and review Discipline deliverables such as: 3D model, Detailed design drawings & As-built drawings      Review drawings issued by other disciplines and incorporate the required data into Discipline drawings      Assist in providing necessary design inputs to other disciplines to enable them in proceeding with their deliverables      Maintain single discipline and inter-discipline check drawings and filing      Monitor progress and maintain the Discipline deliverables register on an ongoing basis      Keep Lead Designer apprised of all activities, progress and concerns, including manpower and budgetary related      Guide / mentor the less experienced Designers      Prepare / review structural design deliverables and carryout activities such as      3D model development Structural scope      General Structural Design instructions      Jacket & Topside Primary steel drawings      Jacket & Topside Secondary steel drawings      Pile / Conductor drawings      Bridge structural drawings.      Flare/vent boom structural drawings      Helideck structural drawings      Structural drawings for Buildings and other structures      Access platform drawings & Equipment support drawings      Material handling drawings and all appurtenance drawings      Seafastening drawings      Review vendor documents and provide comments for structural support requirements      Participate in clash resolution meetings, as required      Familiar with weld symbols      Prepare, issue and update material and weight data take-offs      Assist Fabrication as required in the resolution of construction difficulties relating to design problems, clashes, etc.      Attending site surveys

column1: Senior Engineer / AM / DM - Civil Execution
column2: We at Aliens, are looking for an enthusiastic and dynamic People as a part of our Construction Team. Aliens Group, based in Hyderabad, is revolutionizing the real estate market with over 1500 acres of land poised for transformation to global standards. Established in 2004, Aliens Developers, has reshaped Hyderabad's skyline with projects like Sweet Home Venus, Fast Track, Aliens Blend, Aliens Valley, and Aliens Elite. With ongoing projects like  Aliens Space Station  and  Aliens Hub , they're crafting unique living experiences, blending sustainable architecture, modern technology, and user-centric design. Aliens Group is at the forefront of redefining living standards in India to match the world's best Aliens Group is seeking an experienced and dynamic Senior Engineer - Civil to join our team for a  high-rise residential project . The ideal candidate will have a proven track record in managing and executing large-scale residential projects using  Mivan shuttering technology . This role demands a strong understanding of civil engineering principles, excellent project management skills, and the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams.  Role   Key Responsibilities: Oversee and manage the execution of  residential high-rise projects  from inception to completion, ensuring project timelines, budgets, and quality standards are met. Implement and supervise the high-quality construction, ensuring adherence to Mivan shuttering procedures and best practices. Conduct regular site inspections to ensure compliance with design specifications and quality standards, and address any quality-related issues promptly. Manage and allocate resources effectively, including manpower, materials, and equipment, while maintaining accurate records of resource usage and project progress. Ensure all construction activities adhere to safety regulations and standards, conducting safety audits and promoting a culture of safety awareness among all project team members. Maintain detailed project documentation, including daily reports, progress reports, and project schedules, and provide regular updates to senior management on project status, challenges, and achievements. Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to Mivan shuttering on-site, and optimize resource utilization to enhance productivity and reduce wastage. Collaborate with architects, consultants, contractors, and other stakeholders to ensure project objectives are met. Represent the organization in project meetings, prepare and present project reports and documentation for stakeholders and regulatory authorities. Stay updated with the latest developments in civil engineering, and ensure compliance with local building codes, regulations, and standards & responsibilities    Qualifications and Skills: B.Tech in Civil Engineering from a recognized university. Minimum of 5+ years of experience in managing residential high-rise projects, with proven expertise in Mivan shuttering technology. Strong project management and leadership skills, with excellent communication and interpersonal abilities. Proficiency in project management software and tools, with strong analytical and problem-solving capabilities. Willingness to work on-site and travel as required, with a commitment to continuous learning and professional development.   Perks and benefits   Subsidized food facility will be provided (Breakfast, Lunch, Snacks and Dinner).  For more details kindly reach out at [ 9154080166 |  manisha.p@aliensgroup.in  ]
column11: High Rise Building, Mivan Shuttering, Mivan, Finishing

column2: About HoABL:   We are the House of Abhinandan Lodha. We are a consumer tech brand that disrupts by leveraging technology to make land more accessible, flexible, and secure. Were breaking old traditions and bringing land ownership into the 21st century, making an age-old asset young again, for now and for generations to come. We are on a mission to create intergenerational wealth for our consumers. We are not just reinventing land buying. We are taking every transaction, every experience, every ownership with it into the new. New Generation Land is how we bridge the gap and bring people closer to their dreams. Our Corporate Philosophy:   We believe in a consumers right to reimagine land buying as a positive and simple process. We believe in befriending the planet by giving back what we take it from it. Starting from our blueprint level. We believe in complete transparency in every process. Be it a homeowner, an investor or even a real estate professional. For HoABL, it is not just a piece of land, we believe in the Peace of Land. All our curated developments will be self-sustaining ecosystems built and maintained using sustainable forms of development. Transparency and fairness are the core of all our dealings with local people and resources. HoABL is aware of its ecological, economic, and social responsibility. We ensure the responsible use of natural resources and act in a socially responsible way. We use technology to reinvent the way land is experienced. By digitising its ownership. By using complete transparency in all aspects. By making investments simpler and more accessible and offering lifestyle enhancing amenities that will be a game-changer in the industry. Our Vision: To make land amazing again, by democratising its ownership. We do this by making it a younger, nimbler and a more viable asset for Indians everywhere. Our Mission:   We use technology to reinvent the way land is experienced. By digitising its ownership. By using complete transparency in all aspects. By making investments simpler and more accessible. By covering amenities that will reimagine an industry. column2: We are seeking a highly skilled and detail-oriented Technical Audit Engineer to join our team in the construction domain. The Technical Audit Engineer will be responsible for conducting thorough technical audits of construction projects, ensuring compliance with industry standards, regulations, and best practices. The ideal candidate will possess a strong background in engineering, construction methodologies, and quality assurance processes.  Role & responsibilities     Conduct comprehensive technical audits of construction projects to assess compliance with design specifications, regulatory requirements, and quality standards. Review project documentation, including plans, drawings, specifications, and contracts, to ensure accuracy and completeness. Perform on-site inspections and assessments of construction activities, materials, and workmanship to identify potential issues or deviations from approved plans. Evaluate construction processes and procedures to identify opportunities for improvement and optimization. Collaborate with project stakeholders, including architects, engineers, contractors, and regulatory agencies, to address audit findings and implement corrective actions. Prepare detailed audit reports documenting findings, observations, and recommendations for corrective action. Provide technical expertise and guidance to project teams to facilitate compliance with audit requirements and quality standards. Stay informed about industry trends, regulatory updates, and emerging technologies related to construction and quality assurance. Participate in meetings, training sessions, and professional development activities to enhance skills and knowledge.
